SEI.Class Name: Entertainment & Brand Licensing in Sport, Fashion, and Hospitality Industries

summary_comment: Professor Wilkinson is known for being a tough grader, with significant weight placed on midterms, finals, and a few key assignments. Students find the course challenging due to the minimal number of assignments, where each point is crucial. While some appreciate his passion for the subject and his efforts to foster an engaging classroom environment, many recommend taking a different course to avoid the stress associated with his grading system.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wilkinson is known for being a tough grader, with a significant portion of the grade relying on a few major assignments like the midterm and final exam, while smaller assignments are worth minimal points. Students generally find the course challenging and recommend taking another professor's class if possible.

Ratings.comment: Very tough grader, the weight on the midterm/project and final were crazy. All the other assignments are worth .5 points, yes. So, if you take his course you better hope you don't fall behind or you're done. I highly recommend you take someone else's class

I would not take this class with this professor again- i only chose him because this was the only one open. All assignments were .5 pts, yes you read that right. They will only boost your grade up 2%. There are 3 items that actually matter, and they are weighted HEAVY. Ian is a tough grader. I would highly suggest to take not this course

This was not my favorite class, but overall it was not that bad. The majority of the class is just listening to his lectures and going through the PowerPoint. Your grades rely heavily on the midterm and final. The entire class is only 100 points and 2 exams make up 60 of those points. I would take him again, but it wouldn't be my very first choice

The PowerPoints have very limited information,! The midterm and final are pretty much your big grades without any opportunity to make it up. He never puts in grades consistently. Every week  I had to answer 10-20 questions for 0.5 point.Honestly take this class with another professor, he does not respond to email either.
Tough grader and unfair

Ian was a nice guy but his grading system is hard. There were few assignments in the class so every point mattered. He had one point discussion posts but graded them harshly. The oral reading assignment took a lot of time but make sure you put in the effort because it is worth the same amount of points as the final. His study guides arent helpful.

Dr. Wilkinson is very knowledgeable and caring. He is passionate about literacy and wants all of his students to be the best teachers they can be. There are few assignments, so every point counts on the big assignments. He loves conversation in class and encourages participation. Reading the book and coming to class will help you be fine!

Ian was a very knowledgeable professor who cared a lot about us learning. He was a tough grader which made every assignment a little scary because there were very few, but make sure you put in the time and effort and youll be fine. The course was interesting and he did his best to conduct participatory discussions rather than talk at us.

Try avoiding this professor as much as you possibly can. He was so unaccommodating when he assigned an assignment that required me to interact with a child because of the ongoing pandemic. He also assigned an online group project worth 7 points which was a nightmare since 2 of my group members rarely communicated with the rest of the group

Honestly I would have done better if I watched the lecture videos, but I never did and I still managed to pass. Ian seems like an okay guy, but it was more work than I expected. And there was a group project even thought the class was asynchronous.

Ian can be really boring sometimes, but his Australian accent is fun to listen to and he's a nice guy. He is a bit of a tough grader and expects a lot from you. But he puts all lectures on Carmen, which is helpful. No tests, two papers, a group project, and 5 mini in-class writing assignments. Class is only 100 points so every point really counts.

I found it difficult to receive a satisfactory or "check plus" on papers in this class; difficult, but not impossible.  I ended up with an "A-" overall.  I learned a lot from the class but I found it to be the most difficult class I have taken in pursuit of an M.A. Education at OSU.

Absolutely impossible to earn an A status. If you are trying to earn a 4.0; he will ruin your GPA. He assigns students specific topics to teach the class weekly while he "chills out." Of course he still picks up his pay check at the end. He was not advantageous to my overall learning and teaching development. Waste of my money and time.
Impossible to receive an 'A' in this class.

summary_comment: Professor Caldwell's teaching quality varies significantly according to student feedback. Some find her class manageable with clear expectations and helpful guidance, while others struggle with unclear feedback, confusing quiz questions, and a lack of alignment between quiz questions and course readings. Overall, opinions range from it being an easy class with minimal effort required to it being more challenging with a need for substantial work.
summary_comment_short: Professor Caldwell's teaching quality is mixed; while some students find her class easy and manageable with clear expectations, others struggle with unclear assignment guidelines, confusing quiz questions, and minimal feedback. Overall, her quizzes often do not align with the readings, and she does not provide access to past materials for studying.

Ratings.comment: The actual reading for her class is not that bad, however, often times, her quiz questions do not align with the assigned course readings. She requires several essays throughout the semester for which she gives minimal guidance or clarification. Annoyingly, she does not allow you to look at past discussions/assignments to study for quizzes.

Dr. Caldwell does not give clear feedback or clear guidelines for assignments. She told students to follow the rubric on an assignment for which no rubric was given. She also asks quiz questions in confusing ways and has horrible turnaround time for grading.
Justifiably easy class, easy grading.

Great and helpful professor for a very manageable class. Expectations are super clear; on some assignments she will even give you an example of what your submission should look like. There isn't a ton, so just put in the work and it's an easy A.
She was my favorite professor this summer. The class was super easy, but required a lot of work.

summary_comment: Professor D'Silva is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, described as both very nice and helpful by students.
summary_comment_short: Professor D'Silva is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, described as both awesome and very nice, with students praising her helpfulness.

Ratings.comment: She was awesome then!!!!
She is very nice and helpful.

summary_comment: Professor Wisnor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and genuine care for his students' well-being and professional development. Known for his deep knowledge in the field of teaching, he is both respected and understood for his dedication to helping students become effective educators.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wisnor is highly respected for his dedication to student success and well-being, actively working to ensure they become effective educators. His deep knowledge of teaching combined with his caring approach makes him an outstanding instructor in the field.

Ratings.comment: Wisnor is one of the coolest teachers I've had! He really does care about the students, and wants to do everything in his power to make sure we become great teachers! He cares about your well-being in and out of class, and is overall a really understanding person. He is respected and very knowledgable about the field of teaching.

summary_comment: Professor Thomas is highly regarded for her dedication to the subject matter and her caring approach. While the class does require renting multiple books from the library, which can be initially challenging, students find the final paper and in-class discussions to be well-prepared and engaging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thomas is highly regarded for her dedication to the subject matter and caring approach. While the course requires renting numerous books, which can be initially cumbersome, students find the final paper well within their preparedness and appreciate the substantial in-class discussions.

Ratings.comment: Professor Thomas was very nice and you could tell she cares about the subject. I took Intro to Children's Lit, and I would say the only thing that caused any issue was having to rent 20 or so books from the library, but when you get the hang of it, it isn't bad. Final is a paper you are well prepared for and there is a lot of in-class discussion

summary_comment: Professor Tang is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with students citing unclear grading criteria, ineffective teaching methods, and a harsh grading style. Feedback is met with defensiveness rather than reflection, and her lectures are described as unhelpful and difficult to follow. Students find it challenging to perform well without extensive self-study.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tang is widely regarded as a poor instructor who fails to effectively teach the material and provides unclear grading criteria, leading to low grades despite minimal effort from students. Students report that she is unresponsive to feedback, unhelpful in answering questions, and harsh in her grading, making it challenging to perform well in her class.

Ratings.comment: Terrible teacher. All grading criteria is very unclear, and she doesn't actually teach the material well. Our whole class got C's and D's on a test. Instead of self reflecting and realizing she didn't teach the material well, she said "I guess you guys should have studied harder.". Does not take feedback well, and is unfriendly and unforgiving

Rebecca Tang was awful. She spent all of her class periods lecturing about things that did not help at all. When posed with a question, she beat around the bush and NEVER actually answered the question. The class was only out of 100 points so it was VERY hard to do well. You will have to teach yourself almost everythig

Do everything in your power to not take this class w/ her. This class is only 100 pts so its hard enough as it is and she makes it 10x harder. Very scatterbrained lectures, doesn't answer questions well or care if you need a b- and are struggling, Its possible to get a good grade but you will have to put in a LOT of work. Be ready to teach yourself

The class really isn't hard. It is difficult, however, to get a good grade because there are very few graded assignments and she is insanely tough grader. We had a pretty easy tech project with a clear rubric that most groups followed yet no one in the class got an A on it. Just get ready to not pay attention, since you'll get a B at best.

The class is 100 points total, and Tang is a really tough grader. She does not give clear instructions about projects or assignments. Her exams are difficult and her "study guide" is no more than a list of topics we learned about over the semester. She refuses to answer direct questions, and when someone would confront her she'd talk in circles.

summary_comment: Professor Katz is noted for her strong ideological stance in the classroom, often pushing her views and correcting students' opinions directly. This approach has led to feelings of discomfort among some students, particularly when she calls on reluctant participants and accuses them of disrespect. Additionally, there are recurring issues with her remembering students' names.
summary_comment_short: Professor Katz is known for her strong ideological stance in the classroom, often pushing her views and correcting students' opinions publicly. Her approach to encouraging engagement can be intense, sometimes forcing participation from reluctant students, and her failure to remember students' names has been noted.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Katz, where do I start. She pushed her ideologies onto students. When we share our thoughts, she tells us why we are wrong. She calls on people who don't want to talk and forces engagement. When I shared my thoughts, she said I was disrespectful and that I should not make those comments. She still does not get students' names correct!

summary_comment_short: Professor Groshong is highly regarded by some students for her engaging lectures and personal anecdotes, which they find helpful and interesting. However, other students found her class ineffective, believing she wasted time and failed to address their questions meaningfully, leading them to conclude they learned nothing and strongly advise against her classes.

Ratings.comment: Kim is awesome. Her lectures are very helpful and she has a lot of cool stories.

She was probably one of the worst professors I have ever had. She would waste an hour of class time talking about herself for no reason. And spend an hour "answering questions" but not answering the questions that we were asking. I did not learn anything in this class and all of my classmates agree. I do not recommend taking a class Kimberly.

summary_comment: Professor Henceroth's teaching quality varies widely according to students. Some find her class easy and beneficial, praising her advice and sense of humor, while others describe it as extremely boring, overly demanding, and unfair in grading practices. Overall, opinions are divided, with some students finding it easy and others finding it difficult and unsatisfactory.
summary_comment_short: Professor Henceroth is perceived as an easy grader who provides useful advice and has a laid-back demeanor with a good sense of humor, though her lectures are often criticized for being repetitive and boring. Alternatively, some students find her classes extremely difficult due to their boring nature, excessive assignments, and overly critical grading, leading to significant time commitments.

Ratings.comment: Very easy class! Learned a lot about preparing for the future and received great advice from Casey! Very laid back and good sense of humor.

One of the most terrible classes I have ever taken. Not only is she incredibly boring, but she repeats herself over and over again. Very, very picky when it comes to papers. She took off point for the most ridiculous things, INCLUDING word choice! Also talks about her personal life far too much. Also does not curve grades up like she said she would

She makes it so hard to pay attention because of how boring her lectures are. She literally sits on her desk the entire class and reads off her notes. she assigns way to many papers and assignments, and gives you very little time in between them to have time for other classes. Fairly easy class, but takes alot of your time and is insanely boring!
zzz!  very boring! and talked too much about her personal life. way too easy.  doesn't challenge you enough.

Class is fairly easy if attend class. I did well on the assignments & exams which allowed me to somewhat blow off final paper. Few issues arose that involved politics & personal background that I did not enjoy.
You don't need the book, everything is in the guided notes that she gives.  You may want to fall asleep every time you're in class, but its an easy A.  She's very friendly =)

SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Education & Human Ecology and Degree Planning

summary_comment: Professor Volz is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, making her one of the best instructors at OSU. She effectively engages students, creating a fun and inclusive classroom environment both in-person and online. Her clear, straightforward teaching style and easy grading policy make the class accessible and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Volz is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, making classes both engaging and enjoyable, whether in-person or online. Students appreciate her clarity, straightforwardness, and easy grading, as well as her ability to foster a sense of community among students despite the length of her classes.

Ratings.comment: One of the best teachers I've had at OSU. The class is super fun and you really get to know your classmates. She is also a super easy grader. Our class is almost three hours long but we always got out at least an hour early. Very clear and straight to the point and also easy to talk to. Take this class!
Allison is a great professor and she makes the class very enjoyable even though it is online. Reading a book a week is somewhat time consuming but the class is great and she is an easy grader!

summary_comment: Professor Snowden offers a straightforward and effective teaching approach, providing substantial feedback on four projects and a reflection paper throughout the semester. His classes are hybrid, requiring participation through weekly discussion boards when in-person classes are not held. Following the rubric ensures an easy A, making his course both manageable and rewarding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Snowden offers a rigorous yet structured course with four projects and a reflection paper throughout the semester. He provides substantial feedback, making it straightforward to achieve good grades if students adhere to the rubric, and utilizes discussion boards for engagement during weeks without in-person classes.

Ratings.comment: Four projects due throughout the semester, and a reflection paper. Dr. Snowden gives you a lot of great feedback, if you follow the rubric on all assignments its an easy A. The class is a Hybrid class, so every week that there is no class we had a discussion board to complete.

summary_comment: Professor Frazier is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, demonstrating a genuine care and understanding for her students. Her lectures are engaging and she is known for her helpfulness and passion for education, often showcasing a humorous side that makes her classes enjoyable. Students strongly recommend her.
summary_comment_short: Professor Frazier is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, demonstrating a genuine care and understanding for her students. Her engaging lectures and supportive demeanor make her a highly recommended instructor.

Ratings.comment: Kristi is an amazing teacher and actually cares for her students and understands them. super helpful all the time and her lectures are interesting. She shows her funny personality during class and is very nice, and passionate about helping. Absolutely recommend her.

SEI.Subject: EDUTL
SEI.Class Name: Supervised Student Teaching Internship: Early Childhood Education

SEI.Subject: EDUTL
SEI.Class Name: Supervised Student Teaching Internship: Early Childhood Education

summary_comment: Professor Parker emphasizes class discussions and peer-led teaching, making the class interactive if students engage. Her lectures are minimal, consisting mostly of videos, and she rarely contributes directly to the teaching. While her opinions are clear and she encourages student participation, she can be combative towards differing viewpoints and has a slow grading process.
summary_comment_short: Professor Parker focuses on class discussions and peer-led sessions, making the class interactive for those who engage. However, her contributions are limited to providing clarity on her opinions, which she does not force upon students. Grading is delayed, and she can be confrontational towards differing viewpoints.

Ratings.comment: This class is not difficult. It is a lot of class discussion, if your class is willing to communicate. If not you will find the class boring because it is a lot of videos and your peers will alternate teaching an hour of the class per day. Overall, she's really her opinion is clear but not forced upon you. You feel welcome to share your opinions

Most classes she just put on videos, and we discuss with each other. There's rarely any actual teaching coming from her end. She also is very slow with grading, by the time all my other final grades were in, I still had 5 ungraded assignments in her class, so it's hard to tell where you stand. She's also very combative to differing opinions.

summary_comment: Professor Stewart is perceived as a tough grader with unclear expectations and poor communication, leading to significant stress and frustration among students. Feedback is often lengthy but not particularly helpful, and the grading criteria are not well-defined, causing confusion and dissatisfaction. Students found the class difficult and unengaging, especially for those outside the English Literature concentration.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stewart is known for being a tough grader with unclear expectations and poor communication, leading to high stress levels and low satisfaction among students. Her classes lack structured rubrics and clear assignment guidelines, resulting in inconsistent grading and frustration.

Ratings.comment: I thought this was an easy class but I was wrong. There is absolutely no extra credit and space for your points to change once it has been graded. If you are really good at child literature then take this, if you are not, run!

No rubric or expectations were shared. We were marked down for excluding things that were excluded in her examples (eg. no citations in discussion examples but marked down for no citations). She was also completely unresponsive and gave useless feedback.

I learned nothing and was very stressed out. A waste of credit hours.
This class was extremely boring and is not useful at all to non-ELA concentrations. The Department should strongly consider pulling this class from the major requirements.

Said she wasnt going to grade attendance but passed around an attendance sheet every class and graded participation. Lectures were pointless and everyone was doing other work during class. Seems like she knows what she is talking about but communicates poorly. Assignment requirements were always poorly outlined.

Samantha Stewart was a nice person but a bad professor. She was a very tough grader because she didn't provide clear rubrics or assignment examples and then she blamed it on us. She hardly ever gave feedback and when she did it was lengthy and didn't make sense. I wish I had a better professor for the interesting course content.
Did not know what she was doing.

This professor is an extremely tough grader who gives lots of lengthy assignments. She is the only professor 5225 who assigns book guides every 2 weeks which are long assignments only worth 10 points. There are no clear examples for assignments. She is always looking for more than what the assignment rubric asks. Be prepared for a stressful time.

SEI.Subject: EDUTL
SEI.Class Name: Diverse Literature and Comprehension - Elementary-Middle Education

SEI.Subject: EDUTL
SEI.Class Name: Diverse Literature and Comprehension - Elementary-Middle Education

SEI.Class Name: Diverse Literature and Comprehension - Elementary-Middle Education

SEI.Subject: EDUTL
SEI.Class Name: Diverse Literature and Comprehension - Elementary-Middle Education

summary_comment: Professor Atkinson is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, genuinely caring about her students' well-being, and delivering engaging and fascinating content.
summary_comment_short: Professor Atkinson is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, genuinely caring about students' well-being, and presenting engaging content. Students consistently praise her as one of their favorite instructors.

Ratings.comment: I loveeee professor atkinson. She is one of my all time favorite professors. She GENUINELY cares about you and your wellbeing. Content was also super interesting!!

summary_comment: Professor Rieves excels in her teaching, demonstrating a strong commitment to her students' learning and engagement, making her classes both informative and captivating.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rieves excels in teaching, consistently engaging students and demonstrating a strong commitment to their learning. Her classes are described as both informative and captivating, with a clear focus on student well-being and interest.

Ratings.comment: Professor Rieves is amazing. She cares about you and makes class super interesting. Love her

summary_comment: Professor Spurlock is highly regarded for his passion and dedication to teaching, earning him top ratings from students who find him engaging and supportive. While some note the substantial workload and frequent discussions of political beliefs, his overall teaching quality is praised for being excellent and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Spurlock is highly regarded for his passion and dedication to teaching, making his classes engaging and supportive for students who often praise his adaptability and willingness to help those who struggle. Students also appreciate his high standards and caring nature, though some note the substantial workload and frequent discussions of personal beliefs.

Ratings.comment: Joe is the best professor I've ever had. He clearly has a passion for what he's teaching and it's so nice to see that. He is also very accommodating and will work with anything that you are struggling with. He is the best part of the education program at osu.

Joe is one of the best professors I have ever had! He genuinely cares about his students and what we learn. He has a wonderful presence and is enjoyable to be around. Joe sets high expectations for his students but is also understanding and lenient. Definitely a diamond in the rough of this education program.

He is a nice guy. He cares about making sure students are learning, and he is very adaptable. You will receive a good grade as long as you do all of the work. The caveat is that there's a LOT of work. Lots of reading as well, so it will take up a lot of your time. My only other complaint is how much he talks about his political beliefs in class.

Prof Spurlock is actually one of the funniest professors I have ever had. I laugh multiple times throughout the class, making it much more enjoyable than a regular lecture. The lecture itself is quite... er.. boring but that is not his fault. I like mr. Spurlock!

summary_comment: Professor Manion is considered very boring and technically not qualified as a professor, according to students. His in-person launch seminar had strict attendance requirements and was highly criticized for harsh grading and a lack of engagement with assignments, including poor peer reviews.
summary_comment_short: Professor Manion is widely regarded as a poor instructor, characterized by boring lectures and harsh grading without proper assignment review. Students found his in-person seminar to be ineffective, with weekly mandatory meetings failing to improve their understanding or engagement.

Ratings.comment: Very Boring

Technically he's not a professor I don't think but he taught an in-person launch seminar. Weekly meetings attendance required. He was HORRID - graded super harsh and clearly didn't read some of our assignments. Some peer reviews in class to help us develop our assignments really showed that he was bad all around the board.

summary_comment: Professor Miller is known for his comprehensive yet deeply personal approach to teaching, particularly in classes that involve discussing and grading students' sexual identities. His modules require extensive reading and personal disclosure, which some find overwhelming and traumatic. The instructions are often unclear, leading to confusion and potential grade penalties.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller's teaching approach is highly personalized, focusing on detailed self-disclosure and reflection, which can be overwhelming for students with trauma. The course is rigorous, with extensive reading and unclear instructions, and participation in sensitive topics is mandatory for grading.

Ratings.comment: Don't take this class if you have any type of trauma. For some assignments you're asked to talk about yourself and your sexual identities. You are GRADED on this, so it's not a "if you're ok with sharing" it's a "you must do this or I will take points off." Way too personal and too much reading for each module. Most of the instructions aren't clear

summary_comment: Professor Manouchehri's teaching quality is highly polarized among students. Some find her to be an excellent, caring instructor who provides extensive feedback and genuinely cares about student learning, while others describe her as unprofessional, disrespectful, and difficult to work with, citing unclear expectations and a dismissive attitude towards student input.
summary_comment_short: Professor Manouchehri is highly regarded by some students for her dedication and passion for education, providing extensive feedback and caring about student learning. However, others find her unprofessional, disrespectful, and difficult to engage with, citing unclear expectations and a dismissive attitude towards student input.

Ratings.comment: Extremely unprofessional and disrespectful. I don't believe I took anything out of her class. I did not receive thorough feedback on any assignments and when I regularly sought assistance I was repeatedly told that she prefers ambiguity. Expectations were never clear and she refuses to listen to anything you have to say that she disagrees with.

Dr. Manouchehri is overall a great professor. She provides extensive feedback on assignments and is very willing to work with students on her assignments. Her expectations aren't very clear and she has difficulty organizing the assignments for each week. It's clear that she cares about her students and is passionate about education.
Amazing class.
Terrible instructor.

Indeed lots of work. Do not take her class if your goal is to reach the minimal requirement of graduation. A good professor who cares about how much you learn instead of how easy it is for you to pass.
Horrible person.  She has quite a high opinion of herself and let me tell you, it is not deserved.  Avoid at all cost!!

summary_comment: Professor Paul is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, encouraging critical thinking and personal growth, and providing valuable insights into the field of disabilities, including autism, ADD, and ADHD. However, some students have expressed significant dissatisfaction with his teaching methods, describing them as poor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Paul is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, encouraging critical thinking and personal opinion formation, and offering support and real-world insights into teaching disabilities. However, some students have expressed significant dissatisfaction, describing his approach as "terrible!!!", indicating major issues with his teaching method or effectiveness.

Ratings.comment: Doctor Paul wants everyone to do well, show interest in his class and subject area and form your own opinions and you can get an A

Prof. Paul tried to show many his own hardships and experiences to the students who want to teach disability or Autism, ADD or ADHD. He also introduced many useful persons who already work those field as profession! I learnd a lot more than getting good grade. Speachless...
terrible!!!

summary_comment: Dr. Miranda is highly regarded for her dedication and preparedness, with many students praising her care for her students and her willingness to incorporate feedback to improve her teaching. However, some find her lectures and use of PowerPoint presentations lengthy, though the information provided is accessible. Overall, she is seen as an effective and impactful instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miranda is highly regarded for her dedication and thorough preparation, with many students praising her care for her students and her responsiveness to feedback. However, some find her lectures lengthy and rely heavily on PowerPoint presentations, which can be challenging for engagement.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Miranda is amazing. She cares about all of her students and has very prepared classes. She took feedback from other class evaluations and made changes to accommodate what we requested. She does talk a lot and has a lot of power points, but information is easily accessible. She's the best.
Class was okay - just very general. Dr. Miranda is not a very good professor, and the class was an easy A.
This class will change your life, Dr. Miranda is an amazing woman and good teacher.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Polite is widely regarded as an engaging and enthusiastic lecturer who makes classes enjoyable. However, her teaching style is often criticized for being unorganized, with deviations from the syllabus and unclear due dates and grading criteria. Despite these issues, many students appreciate her clear assignment guidelines and her efforts to ensure students are informed of any changes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Polite is highly regarded for her engaging and enjoyable teaching style, though her classes are noted for being somewhat disorganized and deviating from the syllabus. Grading criteria can be inconsistent and unclear, leading to confusion among students.

Ratings.comment: Tiffany is a great person and she made class very fun and enjoyable. However, it was a bit unorganized and she didn't stick to the syllabus at all. We talked about more interesting things, but you never knew what was due when/did you have class/what your grade was until the last week. Lovely person, but unorganized.

This class is great and Tiffany is so awesome! She was sometimes behind on the syllabus, but at the end of the day she always made sure we were informed of any changes. Criteria for assignments was really clear, and as long as she could tell you put some effort into it, you'll get an A. I would take this class again if I could!

She is the worst, avoid at all costs. As a black student I hated her, God help you if you are white. There is 0 organization, the grading criteria is totally her own, and has nothing to do with what she has on the syllabus. She will try to ruin GPA if she doesn't like you. If I had the choice to retake this class or tear out all of my finger nails.
Tiffany is a fantastic lecturer and obviously cares about her students. I would definitely recommend taking this class with her.

SEI.Subject: ESHESA
SEI.Class Name: Special Topics: Higher Education and Student Affairs

summary_comment: Professor Anthony is criticized for poor feedback practices and inconsistent communication, grading assignments weeks late with minimal commentary and failing to adjust teaching methods despite student disappointment. Assignments are frequently posted tardily, contrary to the syllabus.
summary_comment_short: Professor Anthony is widely regarded as having poor teaching quality due to a lack of timely feedback and inconsistent adherence to the syllabus, posting assignments late and failing to provide substantive or timely grading. Despite student disappointment, the professor has not made significant efforts to improve these issues.

Ratings.comment: Very disappointed in the lack of feedback and effort from the professor. Assignments are graded several weeks later, at best, with little to no feedback. Offers apologies for lack of attention to the course but does not make changes to improve it. Assignments often posted at the last minute, not as promised in the syllabus.

summary_comment: Professor Stefano is highly regarded for his helpfulness and responsibility, effectively facilitating learning. Students describe him as kind and courteous, creating a positive classroom atmosphere. His classes are recommended for their accessibility and quality.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stefano is highly regarded for his effective teaching and supportive demeanor, helping students learn effectively and fostering a positive classroom environment. His kindness and responsibility make his classes both enjoyable and educational.

Ratings.comment: Helpful and responsible instructor. I learned a lot in his class.

The professor is really kind and courtesy. Before I decided to take his class, I looked at one student’s assessment. I am glad that I trusted him. The class is not so hard and the atmosphere is quite good. I highly recommend this professor’s classes.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Abdi, known as Kaha, received mixed reviews from students. While some praised her for being flexible with deadlines and providing supportive feedback, others found her grading delayed and communication sparse, with significant delays in email responses and frequent last-minute changes to class schedules.
summary_comment_short: Professor Abdi, known as Kaha, received mixed reviews; while some students appreciated her flexibility with deadlines and caring approach to feedback, others found her late grading and inconsistent communication to be significant issues. Overall, her teaching style and responsiveness varied greatly between courses.

Ratings.comment: Our class on Foundations of Reading just ended for the semester. That was a bit of a tough course for me! Kaha was really helpful in explaining the many theories that we had to learn. I also just appreciated that Kaha was flexible with deadlines, which made me feel like she really cared about our learning and ourselves as students!

I took Equity & Diversity in Education with Kaha and it was one of my favorite classes that I took. She was very caring in her feedback and allowed me to make up missed assignments after I explained my situation. As long as you communicate with her, she is very accommodating to what you need.

Equity and Diversity is an interesting course. I do not recommend Kaha. She did not grade any of our work until after the semester ended. We did not receive any feedback throughout the semester. Class was moved to Zoom many times with only an hour notice. It also would take 5+ days for email responses- many times she needed reminded.

summary_comment: Professor Tyson offers a highly engaging and discussion-based learning environment that fosters deep understanding of course material. Students appreciate the substantial reading load, which is often entertaining and relevant, though it requires significant out-of-class work. Grading is rigorous, and attendance is mandatory, though exceptions can be made with proper communication.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tyson is known for delivering high-quality instruction through engaging, discussion-based classes that encourage deep understanding of the material. Students appreciate his fairness in grading and his approachable nature, though they note the heavy workload, including substantial reading requirements.

Ratings.comment: I loved this class and professor. This class is mainly discussion based with your peers so it allows for a deep understanding of course material. While the expectation is to read prior to class, the readings were often very entertaining and touched on topics most have personal experiences with. Prof is very understanding and graded very fairly.

Most of class is discussion based so if you're not ok talking in front of small groups of people maybe not a class for you. That being said, all the mundane stuff (papers, reading, assignments) are completed outside of class so get ready to work. 40 pages of weekly reading is normal. A great class to make friends in, Ivy is a lovely person & prof!

She was a great professor but a hard grader. There is LOTS of reading in this class, and it was out of 100 points. Attendance was mandatory, but as long as you emailed her ahead of time for absences, she would excuse you for a handful. The class was discussion-based, so it involved participating each class period and talking to your classmates.

summary_comment: Professor Merry offers a challenging yet manageable course with substantial reading requirements, particularly in some weeks. He is highly responsive and provides excellent feedback, though the class demands a significant time commitment, especially through weekly 200+ word discussion posts and multiple papers, including a substantial final paper.
summary_comment_short: Professor Merry offers clear and manageable class material, though it requires substantial reading and regular engagement. His responsiveness and provision of feedback enhance the learning experience, alongside an optional extra credit assignment at the end of the semester.

Ratings.comment: The class material isn't hard, but some weeks have heavy reading. Starting early and breaking it up over the week helps. Prof. Merry is active, responsive, and provides great feedback. He also offers an extra credit assignment at the semester's end, which is a nice bonus.

Class is not hard as far as material but it is a ridiculous amount of work for a general education class. If you don't enjoy reading and writing a lot, do not take this class. A 200+ word discussion post every week and a paper every few weeks. Most being 2+ pages each. And the last one of the semester is 4-5 pages minimum.

SEI.Class Name: Teaching and Learning of Social Studies Grades Pre-K - 3

SEI.Class Name: Teaching and Learning of Social Studies Grades Pre-K - 3

SEI.Class Name: Teaching and Learning of Social Studies Grades Pre-K - 3

summary_comment: Professor Kearney is highly regarded for her engaging and personable teaching style, which makes classes enjoyable and interactive. She effectively simplifies complex concepts and encourages student participation, leading to a rich learning environment. Students appreciate her care and support, noting that while the material can be dense, the lack of exams balances the workload, and assignments are generally straightforward and easy.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kearney is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style and care for her students, though her classes can be theory-heavy. She effectively simplifies complex concepts, creates an inviting classroom environment, and avoids traditional exams, instead grading on manageable writing assignments.

Ratings.comment: amazing take here
Class is back heavy but there are no exams and she is a very engaging teacher.
She is a great professor and very caring about her students.  The class is a little back heavy but there are no exams so it is compensated.

Professor Kearney is one of the best I have had in my time at Ohio State. She is personable and makes class something you want to go to and engage with. Be sure to read or watch any clips before class as it makes everything click more and gives you a better chance at being engaged with class! The papers are not too hard either.

Professor Kearny is an amazing teacher! She takes some complex concepts and theories and breaks them down for better understanding. Assignments are straightforward and easy. I recommend coming to class prepared, such as watching any clips or read articles she provides, to make the learning experience more engaging. I would take her class again!

She is a great professor and cares so much about her students. Her class was so interesting, and I loved to show up to each class. There are no quizzes or tests, so you are just graded on writing assignments that are really easy. In class conversations helped me to learn a lot of new things and they were great to be a part of.

Ms. Kearney's class was very informative and worthwhile as someone taking the course for a GE requirement. She does an amazing job at connecting with her students and hearing our input. There are no tests or quizzes and the short writing assignments are mostly based on personal experience and topics discussed in class. Definitely a 10/10.

Autumn has been my favorite professor that I have ever had the honor to work with. She is amazing at explaining complex topics and treats her students with the utmost respect. She is truly an inspiration and mentor in my academic career. Her class is always interesting and kept respectable. She is understanding and an absolute gift to work with.

summary_comment: Professor Lara-Steidel is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, being both understanding and supportive throughout the semester. While his course requires significant reading and writing, students find him very approachable and caring, offering extensive assistance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lara-Steidel is an excellent and supportive educator who genuinely cares about his students' success. While his course requires significant reading and writing, he provides ample assistance and is highly regarded for his understanding and dedication.

Ratings.comment: He is an amazing professor very understanding and supportive throughout the whole semester.

Very nice professor, he cares about his students. Not a lot of points though. There are 2 philosophy papers, participation and every week was a 1-point note taking. So the papers are crucial. He offers a lot of help though. Overall great professor just be prepared to write and read A LOT.

summary_comment: Professor Ansari is known for his rigid grading criteria and lack of flexibility, often docking points for minor issues. Students find his office hours unhelpful and his explanations confusing. His approach to extra credit can result in deductions rather than gains, leading to an overall negative teaching experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ansari is known for his stringent grading criteria and rigid rubrics, leaving little room for interpretation. Students find his office hours unhelpful and his explanations confusing, leading many to advise against taking his courses.

Ratings.comment: He docks points on the most trivial of matters. The rubrics are very rigid in what he's looking for, and there's no room for nuance. I found his office hours unhelpful, and his reasoning confusing even after talking to him a few times. On extra credit he will dock points down the hundredths for random reasoning. I don't recommend him.

SEI.Subject: HDFS
SEI.Class Name: Seminar in Human Development and Family Science

SEI.Subject: HDFS
SEI.Class Name: Seminar in Human Development and Family Science

summary_comment: Professor Cruz is highly regarded for her dedication and engaging presence in the classroom, making her classes enjoyable and worthwhile despite the general education (GE) requirements. However, some students find the GE launch aspect and online format less effective, with one expressing frustration over the lack of substantive grading and the emphasis on attendance during virtual sessions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cruz is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to her students, making her class a highlight despite the general education (GE) requirements being less appealing. However, some students find her strict approach during online sessions, particularly for GE launch, to be overly harsh and unnecessary.

Ratings.comment: She is an amazing professor who truly cares about her students. Yes, GE sucks but she honestly makes it worth coming to class. Her personality and charisma made it my favorite class to go to throughout the week to see her!! 10/10 would recommend
GE launch sucks. She makes it worse. This class is a joke, there is no need to actually grade my assignments. Calls out kids for not paying attention on zoom. ITS A ZOOM FOR GE LAUNCH, WHO CARES

summary_comment: Professor Hidayat excels in fostering a vibrant and engaging classroom environment, prioritizing community building and student involvement. Unlike other instructors, he encourages students to lead discussions, inject humor, and enjoy the learning process together, making his classes exceptionally enjoyable and memorable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hidayat excels in fostering a vibrant and engaging classroom environment, prioritizing community building and student involvement over traditional lecture formats. His approach makes learning enjoyable and memorable for his students.

Ratings.comment: Angga is truly an incredible person. In the education program, professors always talk about the importance of building a community, but they fail to do so. Angga is different. Our cohort had so much fun in his class. Angga would let us take control of the class, make jokes, and laugh with each other. Such a refreshing change from other professors.

summary_comment: Professor Bishop is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by her approachability, wealth of experience, and fairness in grading. She effectively shares her extensive knowledge and personal insights, making her a memorable and beloved professor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bishop is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, providing insightful advice and fair grading. Students consistently praise her approachability and generosity in grading, making her a favorite among them.

Ratings.comment: Ashlan is such an amazing woman! She used to be a teacher and is now pursuing a PhD at Ohio State. She was so nice to all of us and always gave great advice and information relating to her experiences. She always graded super fair and, in my opinion, was a very generous grader. Highly recommend Ashlan! Definitely one of my favorite professors.

summary_comment: Professor Hirvela is known for his expertise in TESOL and dedication to improving pedagogy, particularly in reading and testing. While his teaching style can be somewhat reserved, students find his classes invaluable for enhancing their educational practices. Despite being busy with various responsibilities, he remains supportive and encouraging, making his courses both informative and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hirvela is known for his dedication to pedagogy and TESOL field, bringing extensive experience and intellectual acumen to his classes, though students note that his availability for academic support can be limited due to heavy administrative and research commitments. Despite this, many find his classes valuable for improving teaching skills and refining pedagogical approaches.

Ratings.comment: He's alright.Unfortunately, he is so overwhelmed with responsibilities outside the classroom, e.g.,advising grad students, committees, research, he isn't much help if his course becomes a struggle for you. Not his fault though.I'm sure he has to do all this if he wants to keep his job!That's the problem with research I institutions.

I've had Dr. Hirvela for a number of classes and I've learned a lot from him regarding the teaching of reading as well as testing.  As was stated, he may sound dull but for those of us who want to improve our pedagogy and don't expect to be 'entertained' in class, his classes are a must for anyone in education.

Hirvela is definitely one of the sweetest, most unassuming and most encouraging professors I have studied under. The reading load is extremely reasonable. And unlike some closted writing teachers, he brings a vast experience, keen sensitivity and intellectual acumen to the TESOL field. His class certainly helped me refine my pedagogy a lot. *****
