summary_comment: Professor Hite is widely regarded as the absolute best teacher, known for being highly organized and well-prepared. Students appreciate the interesting and creative assignments he provides, and many strongly recommend his courses. His teaching significantly enhances students' learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hite is widely regarded as the absolute best teacher, known for being extremely organized and well-prepared. Students find his assignments both interesting and creative, leading to significant learning outcomes.

Ratings.comment: THE ABSOLUTE BEST!

Absolutely the best teacher I have ever had.  Dr. Hite is extremely organized and prepared for every class.  Assignments are interesting and creative.  Would recommend to all taking this course.  You'll really learn a lot from Dr. Hite.

SEI.Subject: ART
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Digital Photography and Contemporary Issues

summary_comment: Professor Teeple is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and compassionate nature, consistently praised by students for creating a supportive and engaging learning environment. His dedication to students' well-being and passion for education are evident in his approach, which includes offering extra support through casual meet-ups and making lectures both enjoyable and effective.
summary_comment_short: Professor Teeple is widely regarded as one of the best instructors, known for his compassion, kindness, and genuine care for students' well-being. Students appreciate his supportive approach, engaging lectures, and willingness to connect outside of class, creating a positive and motivating learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Honestly one of the best profs I've ever had. He's such a great guy and is so compassionate, kind, and caring.

Jamie he is a really nice guy, he's invested in your overall well being. He always stresses in class that he wants students to take care of themselves and their mental health first before worrying about his class. He always says meet up with me we will do coffee and chat. GREAT PROFESSOR!

I love Jamie Teeple. Hes absolutely one of the best professors Ive ever had at Denison. Hes passionate about education, brings food to class, dresses up, and empathizes with our work loads. Hes seriously a breath of fresh air.

Can't even begin to explain how great Teeple is, not just as a professor but as a person as well. He encourages his students to speak to him outside of classes and engages you while in class with a motivated and fun learning environment. Great guy and I would definitely take one of his classes again!

He helped me a lot with getting started doing high-school class observations, and is overall just a genuinely great guy. Loves talking to students, has lots of experience, and is passionate about what he does. His class is too easy though; quizzes were completion-based (100% earned you extra credit), for example. (This class was at CSCC)
Love this professor. Wish all of them were like him.

Jamie is amazing! He is by far one of the best professors yet! You can tell he was always supposed to teach, very good at it and makes you feel appreciated and welcomed to do anything you want. Lecture are very engaging and good at keeping your attention, but you're not going to fail if you miss a class.

summary_comment: Professor Andrew Trevarrow is highly regarded for his clear and straightforward approach to teaching, making the workload manageable for students who keep up with the weekly assignments. His classes, such as EDUTL 2368 and EDUTL 3356, are known for their organization and the use of Carmen effectively. Students appreciate his dedication to the subject matter and his willingness to help, though they note the substantial amount of work required, including frequent discussions, essays, and attendance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Andrew Trevarrow is highly regarded for his clear and straightforward teaching approach, making the class manageable as long as students keep up with the weekly work. His organization and dedication to the subject matter are evident, though the class requires significant effort, including weekly discussions and substantial essays.

Ratings.comment: Andrew Trevarrow very good professor. The grading for this class was straight forward and as long as you kept up with the weekly work, you'll be fine. EDUTL 2368 (online) - weekly literature readings - weekly group discussion post/reply - 5 short essays on academic journals of your choosing - 1 final 2500-3000 essay at the end of the semester

While I probably wouldn't take this class if I didn't have to, Trevarrow is a great prof. You can tell he loves teaching this class. It is a lot of work (a 400-700 word post every week and a 2500-word literary analysis at the end) and a loooong class period, but overall a good experience. Also, you are required to have paper copies of the books.

Andrew is a very organized professor. The class is organized, and he uses Carmen very well. EDUTL 3356 is a discussion driven class. You will read one YA book a week, and discuss in small groups, but its really not too bad as his book choices are great! He is also always able to help and answer questions if need be. Overall a great professor!

This class was presented as an easy GE for any section. This one was in person, and we were required to do SO MUCH WORK. Attendance was mandatory and he took roll call every day, and every single week you have to write stupidly in-depth discussion questions that you don't even hardly use. There are two huge projects worth 30% of your grade each.

summary_comment: Professor Folden is highly regarded for his engaging and effective teaching methods, particularly in large lectures. Students appreciate his clear explanations, fair grading, and efforts to connect with them, even in an online setting. While some find his teaching style dynamic and enjoyable, others note that it can be challenging to follow due to its non-linear nature.
summary_comment_short: Professor Folden is highly regarded for his engaging and personalized teaching style, which makes even heavy writing classes accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate his clear explanations, fair grading, and dedication to helping them understand the material while fostering a sense of community through participation and name recognition.

Ratings.comment: I have never felt so connected with a professor for an online class before. I felt like he really knew me, and I got to know him despite never meeting him in person. This is a heavy writing class but all of the assignments are wonderfully explained with clear grading criteria. No typical textbook, but a required book with weekly quizzes.

Dr. Folden is so awesome. His lectures are engaging, he wants students to understand the concepts, and cares about getting to know students. He is fair about grading. Attendance is mandatory, but you get two or three excused absences. I only utilized the book to help with the quizzes and the exams. Weekly quizzes are online. Participationkey!

He's got it all - in all his years of teaching he perfected his pedagogy. I loved every minute in his class (despite the early hours). I wish one day to teach in a similar way. I would take all his classes if I could.

This guy is AMAZING. He is hilarious, constantly making jokes, but you still actually learn a lot of material. I never once got tired, distracted, or bored in this class. HIGHLY recommend. The tests are slightly hard but if you study the notes and prepare your essays (get questions ahead of time) you'll do just fine.

I had him for HDFS 560 &670.01. He was an awesome teacher and made class interesting! He takes the time to learn names of students. Exams are mult choice & essay and if you complete the study guide you will do great on exams. His papers are long but he grades them really easy. If you go to class and take notes, and participate you will be fine!

I thought he was an awesome teacher! I had no problem with the test and he had "pop quizzes' that he told you about, and he graded the paper very easily. Not to mention I thought he was inspiring and soo funny!

He is all over the place. Jumps around a lot so it's hard to follow. His midterm was 70 MC and then 7 essay questions on top of that, then made the class stay after for an hour of lecture. He has personality, I'll give him that. But he should not be teaching.

I loved his class. I ended up not reading but used my book for the paper and studying for the tests. The tests are difficult but if you study his study guide completely, they will be easy. I completed the study guide and gave myself a week to study for his tests and they were never a problem for me

I loved this class and Dr. Folden was so much fun.  He's kinda crazy but very funny.  The subject seems easy but the tests are extremely hard.  Multiple choice section is worded strange.  I always went to class, took good notes and paid attention, and studied a decent amount for the exams and only got C's.  But with the paper I earned a B overall.
one of the funniest professors I have had. He is very straight forward and mandates class participation. I loved his class and his teaching style

While he is intimidating and crazy at times, I actually learned a lot from him and somewhat enjoyed the class. On the first day I thought it would be terrible but it turned out OK. Just go to class and take good notes.
The class is not very hard if you pay attention and go to class. The professor is very unprofessional and not very helpful.

How does he still have a job? His teaching is all surface level stuff, he's insulting, and has a personality that inhibits learning. He knows nothing of research. Has he ever done any? Do not go to him for advice. He's a basket case. I believe that he lies too.
Amazing! If you are really interested in learning and having a good time, this is the person! I honestly can't wait until I have him this summer!

Yes, Dr. Folden keeps things interesting, but I feel that he is very intimidating.  He shows favoritism in the class and makes it known.  He is terrible at returning email.  He knows his stuff, but he jumps back and forth too much.  He does make sure that everyone understands something before moving on.  Good luck with him he's tough!
Not a good guy and a so-so teacher. Too many people think the entertaining thing is important.

Hes great!  he sings and dances during while he waits for someone to answer...very enthusiatic...and when he remembers something or has a great idea...he goes...OH!!  really loud!  funny :)  very interactive with the students...mandatory attendance but he makes great use of your time :)  really makes you see things from other perspectives!  GREAT!!

I LOVE DR. FOLDEN. He is hilarious. My class was at 9:30 am which would usually result in me falling asleep but instead he woke me up.  I hope I can find another class to take with him before I graduate.  This was my favorite class I've taken thus far at OSU and he's my favorite professor as well. I strongly recommend taking him if you get the chan

Dr. Folden is awesome. He's also my honors advisor, but I have always found him to be helpful. His jokes crack me up, and we all love when he sings. Or when he forgets a certain point and he squeals "OH!". Lol. I love this guy :)

YOu have to go to class to do well on the tests.  He keeps your attention and is rather funny, but his tests are extremely hard.  He does curve...sometimes. :) If I had the option of another teacher, I would have chosen the other.  Folden is entertaining though!
intimidating

He's very nice and funny, keeps you awake in class.  I just always felt rushed in note taking, and there are A LOT of notes.  Don't worry about the book too much, he covers it all in class.   Just go and participate and study your notes (if you can write fast enough).  The tests aren't too difficult.

Folden is a great teacher.  He tends to pick on students, but it is all in good fun.  He is very energetic and keeps people interested in what he is teaching.  It is a must to go to class and to study, but it is not hard to go to class because he is so fun.  I highly recommend him.  I'm taking another one of his classes next quarter!
HE IS THE WROST PROFESSOR EVER MET. I DID NOT LIKE HE MAKING JOKS. IT WAS NOT FUN AT ALL. HE DID NOT LIKE HELP STUDENTS.
He is a good teacher. People don't like him because you actually have to go to his class and study. He's not bad, and not offensive; he just makes jokes.
Although he makes boring information interesting, his tests are IMPOSSIBLE. I am an A student and shockingly got a B+ in the class. I studied extremely hard for the final, and bombed it!
He is very clear in what you need to do to get an A. Just go to class and study for tests and you'll be fine. His class is fun and entertaining!

Dr. Folden has an obvious dislike for many of his students. He also has serious problems with offending people, being unprofessional, and verbally attacking people. Having a sense of humor is not enough to see the light with this guy. Such comments make me wonder who is really writing the reviews.

Dr. Folden is a great teacher. He knows his information and is very helpful. while he can come off as a little brash at times, he is actually very kind and funny. If you have a sense of humor, you will be fine.   :)

Dr. Folden is the best professor I have had. He wrote me my graduate school letter, we have talked several time post undergrad. He cares about his class, material,& students. I can't say enough good about him. I had him 5 times in undergrad & would take him again in a heartbeat.

I thought Dr. Folden did a great job communicating matter at times, and that he was VERY amusing! He cracked everyone up in the two classes for which I had him, and he was available if we needed any help. He DEFINITELY made an 8.30am class fly by! :)
Agree with last poster-not as amusing as he thinks. A lot gets lost in his need to entertain. Will keep his therapist rolling in money for life.
rude, treats females poorly, too much talk of drinking instead of class material, not nearly as amusing as he thinks he is.
UNPROFESSIONAL. Note that he is NOT the department head. He is an adjunct lecturer and head of teaching. Not tenure track. He intentionally misleads his students on this.

I've had him for 3 classes and he has been VERY helpful.  He's very funny and has helped me get a job I like.  If you sit in the back, he wont know who you are, meaning you might feel left out, your fault.  He's the best professor I've ever had.
Horrible, picks on certain students in the class, his sexual jokes are not funny, alienates some students, goes off on tangents, need I say more? Its pathetic that he is the department head.
The very fact that he alienates a large proportion of his students is a serious problem. He’s in the wrong profession and doesn’t even know it!
at first I liked his class, but his personal life and the interference of others needs to stay out of the classroom!
Very entertaining teacher who really enjoys his job.

Dr. Folden does NOT care about his students. Don’t let his act in the classroom fool you. He can be entertaining and he keeps you awake but that’s insignificant in light of insults, inappropriate comments, and unprofessional behavior. He has a few axes to

Dr. Folden is one of the best teachers I've ever had.  He can be a little strict, but it's not a problem unless you're really lazy.  He really cares about what he's teaching and just wants to make sure everyone gets something out of his classes.

Dr. Folden is very clear in class about what will be on his exams. He can be intimidating, but is humour is very entertaining. I really enjoyed his teaching skills. He is not at all boring - unlike other college professors. He interacts with his students.
No Comments
Dr. Folden is a great teacher! VERY fair, clear and fun!
Although Dr. Folden can get a bad rap for being tough, if students do the work, they'll be fine. He is very entertaining, and is obviously passionate about this field of study.
I plan on filing a formal complaint against him. He is an arrogant man who allows personal issue to interfere with his professional life. Avoid his classes!
This teacher is not helpful at all, he interogates his students, and is not pleasant to be in class with.

Tough but fair policies.  Given the deficits of a quarter system, he strives to push as much content as possible--and finds a balance between information overload and focusing on what's really important.

He is so-so teacher but other qualities make him awful. Yes, he is entertaining if that is what you need but he is self-centered and makes bad jokes at the expense of students. He is not helpful when it counts.
Dr. Folden is a great teacher.  He's really funny and his class is never boring.
Awesome teacher, he's very entertaining and hilarious, so class is NEVER boring!

summary_comment: Professor Sungjun is known for giving low grades on assignments, which significantly impacts students' GPAs. Students often complain about excessive homework given during breaks and holidays, with little to no feedback until regular workdays, leading to a generally poor perception of the professor's teaching quality.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sungjun is known for assigning a significant amount of homework, particularly during breaks and holidays, which is not always graded promptly. Students consistently report receiving low grades on assignments, significantly impacting their GPAs.

Ratings.comment: This course is supposed to be a course that teaching student how to get better grade in college. However, this professor always give low grade to assignment. My grade of this class has the lowest grade in all my classes. It's kind of ridiculous.
Bunch of homework during spring break and other holidays but not graded them until work days! Also every homework graded so critical and make your GPA lower.

summary_comment: Professor Cheng provides high-quality instruction, focusing on constructive feedback that significantly enhances students' academic writing skills, fostering greater confidence in their writing abilities.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cheng provides high-quality instruction, focusing on constructive feedback that significantly enhances students' academic writing skills, boosting their confidence in their writing abilities.

Ratings.comment: Dora gives constructive feedback for my writing. I have learned a lot about academic writing in this class. I am now more confident about my writing!

summary_comment: Professor Yaluma is passionate about his subject and sets high expectations for his students, though his teaching approach emphasizes extensive reading and writing. Despite caring about student success and offering support for missed work, his class is perceived as demanding and not well-structured, with significant issues regarding feedback and grading. Some students find it challenging and draining.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yaluma is known for caring about student success and offering opportunities for makeup work, though his class involves significant reading and writing. Despite this, many students find him to be an ineffective facilitator who fails to provide timely feedback or proper guidance, leading to a generally negative classroom experience.

Ratings.comment: Chris genuinely cares about student success and provides opportunities for missed work. The course is easy but has lots of reading and writing to do. If you don't like reading and writing papers DON'T take this class

THE WORST instructor I have ever had at OSU - does not give any feedback, takes an excessively long time to grade, and does not properly facilitate discussions. It is so clear that he never knows what is happening on the syllabus and he is just teaching someone else's material. I HATED going to this class every day but had to.
Chris is passionate about the subject and has high expectations for his students.

summary_comment: Professor Khandaker is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently receiving praise for her kindness, dedication, and commitment to student success. Students appreciate her balanced approach to assignments and her ability to connect educational psychology concepts to practical applications in their future careers. Her availability and willingness to provide support further enhance her effectiveness as an instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Khandaker is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently receiving praise for her kindness, care for student success, and dedication to helping students understand and apply educational psychology concepts effectively. Students appreciate her balanced approach to assignments and her commitment to their learning and future careers.

Ratings.comment: I absolutely loved taking Ed Psych with Naima. She is very kind and wants everyone to succeed. She doesn't overload with assignments but the class is far from a waste of time. It was my favorite class to go to this semester.

Best instructor I have met so far. She really cares about students' learning and is always willing to offer help and advice. Her lecture is not merely talking about Ed Psych concepts, but really connecting them to our future career. She gave many means of application from textbook content and those are the most valuable things to learn from her.
Great teacher. She really cares about the students and wants everyone to do well.

She was the best professor I had so far in college. Great lectures, easy/very clear assignments. Naima was there for the soul purpose to help students learn and she is always willing to help if you have a problem.

Naima is one of the best teacher that I have ever had. You can tell that she really cares about her students and wants us to do well. We only had one midterm and we were able to make corrections for full credit back. She also provided us with tons of resources to use once we become teachers.

summary_comment: Professor Vocal is known for being a fair grader and approachable, though her class can be challenging due to unclear due dates and expectations. Despite organizational issues, she is described as very nice and helpful, particularly for those interested in careers involving children. However, some students find her grading criteria confusing and the class more difficult than advertised, with inconsistent deadlines and unclear rubrics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Vocal is known for being a fair grader and generally approachable, though her class can be disorganized with unclear due dates and expectations. Despite these issues, the course is considered relatively easy, provided students put in the necessary effort.

Ratings.comment: Instructor Vocal is a fair grader and a nice person. As long as you put effort into the work that you turn in, you will be fine. There were definitely times when due dates and expectations were unclear but if asked to clarify, she will explain it better. Overall, this is a pretty easy GE course but you have to put some time into it if you get her.

This class really wasn't all that bad. No, there definitely was not organization, but she was extremely nice. The class is definitely helpful if you plan to be an elementary teacher or are planning for any career that involves children. She's an easy grader up until your final; which is understandable. Attendance is important. Got an A.
Homework/paper's rubrics are not even clear. She asked to cite at least 5 sources and she said this meant you needed to cite 6 sources. Haven't you learnt math? :D

EDULT 2368 is supposed to be one of the easiest GE classes at OSU. But Patricia Vocal's class would give you the hardest time ever. No deadline is posted on carmen you have to check your syllabus every day to make sure you don't miss the deadline.

summary_comment: Professor Tayese is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, with students praising his dedication and passion for the subject matter. His engaging approach makes him a standout educator in his field.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tayese is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, with students praising him as an outstanding instructor who goes above and beyond in their education. His dedication and passion for teaching are evident, making him a standout professor in the eyes of his students.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Blaise is a fantastic professor. He is the goat. I would die for him

summary_comment: Professor Schey is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and genuine care for his students, evident from his multiple positive reviews. His classes are discussion-based and demanding, fostering a deep understanding of the material through extensive reading and project work, though some find the structure and classroom dynamics less conventional.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schey is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and genuine care for his students, fostering an engaging and discussion-based learning environment that feels natural rather than forced. His courses are demanding, requiring significant effort through extensive reading and project work, but students find his passion and knowledge invaluable.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Schey is now at Auburn University but he is Awesome. He is always super accommodating and he really cares for his students. Also his class is super discussion based but not in the awkward forced dialogue normally expected in college courses. I loved all of his classes (I have taken him 4-5 times now)
Great professor! Assigns a lot of reading and you have to put effort it to the course, but if you work hard, you'll do well. Nice guy and knows his stuff; passionate about literacy.

Things are due three days after class and three days before the next class. The assignments require reading and video watching. Lots of "film making" required for projects. Lectures are long. Break given 20 minutes before class lets out. Strange dynamic/classroom community-- doesn't feel comfortable.

summary_comment: Professor Wardwell's teaching is generally perceived as challenging and monotonous, with unclear grading criteria and three-hour lectures that are difficult to follow. Despite some positive feedback about lenient grading and extra credit opportunities, many find the class structure and content hard to engage with, particularly in a lengthy weekly session.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wardwell's lectures are often described as boring and difficult to follow, with unclear grading criteria and long, mandatory 3-hour sessions that students find challenging to stay engaged in. Despite some positive feedback about lenient grading and extra credit opportunities, many find her classes hard to understand and tedious.

Ratings.comment: Boring and hard to understand. Grading criteria is never clear. Bring other schoolwork to do during the 3 hour lectures. Two exams, and one final group project with two papers and a presentation.

attendance is only mandatory because you have to sign in. VERY  hard to understand her, and she doesn't do very well with budgeting class time, especially for a 3 hour lecture (1x a week). The class is boring, mostly common sense.

She tries to make the most of a 3 hour class. First part of semester was her lectures. All tests have extra credit. 1st was a normal test, 2nd take home, no final. There is an individual short presentation and a big group presentation with a group paper. She grades pretty leniently. Takes attendance every class. Easy class!
Easiest class ever! The best two credits, I've earned.

summary_comment: Professor Thomas is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging content, making his class both practical and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his ability to spark discussions and connect theoretical concepts with real-world applications, particularly beneficial for education majors. His grading is described as fair and forgiving, with assignments generally easy to excel in.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thomas is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging content, making his class both practical and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his approachable nature, easy grading system, and ability to spark meaningful discussions relevant to real-world applications.

Ratings.comment: Great professor! One of my favorite classes so far at OSU. Very applicable content, cheap books, extremely easy grader. His class was easy yet very interesting and I looked forward to going to every class.

TAKE THIS CLASS! Mr. Thomas is an awesome instructor, I can't believe it took me until my last semester of college to have such a great teacher. This class was practical, applicable, and interesting. I learned a lot that I will use in real life situations and the book(s) you read are interesting- not boring. Best teacher/class I've had at OSU.

Awesome class! Likes to spark interesting discussion and make them based one real, tangible things. Very applicable to actual classrooms for education majors and deals a lot with gray areas. You write a few papers and they are generally easy to get full credit and if you talk to him he is very understanding and willing to offer revisions.

summary_comment: Professor Bruce is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and genuine care for her students. She models best practices learned from her own teaching experience and encourages active participation in class activities. Her classes involve significant reading but offer generous grading with extensive feedback, making them accessible even with minimal effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bruce is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style and genuine care for her students, though her classes require significant reading and minimal testing. Her generous grading and detailed feedback make the workload manageable for those who invest time, while the class remains relatively easy with opportunities to perform well with minimal effort.

Ratings.comment: She was my favorite professor thus far. As a former teacher she modeled many practices that she taught us. She really cared about her students and tried to include us in the class activities. There was a lot of reading that most people did not do. There were a few papers. She grades very generously, but write extensive comments on every assignments

Rebekah Bruce was a great professor, easy A if you are willing to put time in it but there are multiple children novels you have to read and a bunch of mini assignments.  All very easy but a little time consuming.  Would recommend if you are a hard worker and looking for an A.

No tests.  Had to read several books, but you could easily fake your way through class discussions.  I put in minimal effort and got 100% in this class.  Rebekah is super laid back and the class is interesting and SUPER easy.  I would definitely recommend taking this class from her

summary_comment: Professor Guanci demonstrates strong care for her students and fosters an engaging, discussion-based learning environment. However, she faced initial challenges with organization and grading timelines, which improved over time. Despite this, she was a generous grader and placed less emphasis on extensive reading, focusing instead on in-class discussions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Guanci shows strong care for her students and fosters an engaging, discussion-based learning environment, though she initially struggled with organization and grading timeliness. She is a generous grader, with assessments including projects, a paper, and a final, but places less emphasis on extensive reading.

Ratings.comment: Sin was adjusting to teaching at the college level, so she was a little unorganized and took awhile to grade. There were a few projects, a paper, and a final, but she was very generous grader. I didn't really have to read, but the class is very much discussion based about readings. Overal, she cared about her students and their thoughts.

summary_comment: Professor Glassman is widely regarded as an engaging and easy instructor, known for his unconventional teaching methods and relaxed approach. Students appreciate his interesting presentation style and the opportunities he provides for earning high grades with minimal effort, though some find the class content and exams challenging due to their unique format. Overall, his classes are generally seen as easy A's with a focus on participation and blog posts rather than traditional studying.
summary_comment_short: Professor Glassman is highly regarded for his engaging and unconventional teaching style, which many students find refreshing and easy, though some found the exams challenging due to their unique format. His approach emphasizes participation through blogging and group work, offering opportunities for high grades with minimal attendance, while others felt the class lacked depth and practical value.

Ratings.comment: Lovely man! Sexy approach to teaching. I need more Glassman in my life. #Glassmaniac

Dr. Glassman is a brilliant thinker. The class is easy but the material is presented in a very interesting way. It's nothing like any of the other stupid HDFS classes. It's a shame people don't take advantage of this interesting material and expect to just sit back and do nothing to graduate.

winter 2011 was the first course he taught in a different way... all the assignments were on a blog and the midterm and final were completed as a group. EASIEST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN if you are breathing you can get an A.

Ridiculous class. Hard to study for midterm and final considering most of the questions were made up by students and were very unclear. They were also random facts Glassman spit off in class that don't really matter

SO many people in my class complained because of his relaxed/unconventional teaching style, but to be honest these people must've just been lazy or not paying attention!! He gives u the opportunity to get a FREE A on both the midterm & final if your blog posts are good enough & i got free As on both so DO NOT BLOW OFF THIS AMAZING OPPORTUNITY!=)
EASY A. you don't need to go to this class besides the midterm and final. He's a down to earth dude and can relate to students. If you want an A and don't want to attend class.. take this course!!!

Awful. Waste of time. Didn't learn a thing. I only did well because I took psych along with it and we were learning basically the same thing. I never went to class because we only watched video clips and blogged. Pointless.

This class was super easy. It's like a mix of psychology and sociology. There is no real need for the book. Listen in lecture and try to take notes. He does not have any slides. He just talks. Tests are ok. Be sure to remember defintions and be able to apply them. The class was interesting.

I enjoyed this class! I thought he was a great professor. The lectures were always interesting and entertaining and I learned a lot. The tests were hard so I ended up with a B in the class. It helps to bring a laptop and type his lectures as he talks. I never used the book.

Don't buy the book - just google terms but also go to class and type what he says because a lot of it is verbatum on the tests. He curved tests and is providing extra credit for the final. Other than that you have one easy paper and if you pay attention/go it should be easy. He's funny and teaches "old-school" but his lectures make up for that.

NOT recommended. Uses out of date information. Doesn't know any current research. Uses tests from old classes so you didn't learn some of what is on exams. Is abrasive and offensive in class. His TA doesn't have office hours so you have to work with him to get info. Don't need to buy textbook. I had to relearn info since his info isn't current.

He was a waist of my time. I didn't learn anything from his class and he claims he gives extra credit "if he learns your name" but he never asks for your name. His tests can be tricky but if you come to every class and study his review sheet you should be ok. Don't bother buying the book he actully says he "disagrees" with the book.
pay attention and go to class and youll get a good grade.
Horrible.

very hard to understand, contradicts himself and confuses himself. trick questions on tests and study guides do not include everything as he says they do. very boring lectures and don't bother buying the book just google the terms on the study guides-that's all i ever used the book for
Entertaining and easy.If you go to class you'll do fine.

I have taken more then 1 class with him and he is my very favorite professor. He is very untraditional, smart and know a great deal. However, he is challenging and thought provoking, so it requires intelligence.
amazing man, great thinker. anyone who is not impressed, lacks compassion and intelligence.
One of the worst teachers I have ever had.  It was a horrible class and I did not learn anything!

Possibly the worst teacher ever! The study guide is given 2 days before the test and he won't help you figure out whats on it. Watch out because he makes jokes that are offending and makes you fee like an idiot if you don't answer or answer a question wrong. Not very helpful but thinks he is. Find someone else.

He is ok. Only study the guide he gives you before the midterm or final.  Answer questions or make sure he knows your name because he gives a bunch of extra credit. Even though an ok teacher, I am sure you can find someone easier.
This man is awful and gross. He teaches multiculturalism, yet he is THE MOST **** person I have ever met. I am embarrassed he represents this university.
Horrible!!! Not helpful, boring lectures, makes no sense. Test are hard. However very easy on papers.

This is my 4th and last year at OSU and I would have to say that he is the worst professor I've ever had in my college career. I took this class to learn about child development, and literally left the class feeling dumber than when I started. I don't know how he's still teaching!

He is disgusting. I have learned absolutely nothing in this class...except for his favorite foods. He laughs at everything you say, and then keeps asking you to answer questions. He makes you feel stupid for every answer. I do not know how he is a teacher!

WORST CLASS EVER.... AND HORRIBLE PROFESSOR! THIS IS A VERY IMPORTANT CLASS FOR EDUCATION MAJORS AND I HAVE LEARNED NOTHING FROM IT BUT WHAT KIND OF FOOD PEOPLE EAT IN THEIR CULTURES! THE WORK IS MEANINGLESS AND A COMPLETE WASTE OF TIME.... WORST CLASS SO FAR AT OSU AND WORST TEACHER!
Worst class ever.  Listening to him tlak is like finger nails scratching the chalkboard.  I cannot believe I pay money to take this class.

Awesome professor there is definitely a reason why he has tenure.  I love his style of teaching very new york attitude wise.  He grades easy and sparks lively discussion.  I love the way he DOES NOT sugarcoat things.  Too many profs in HDFS do...highly recommend him.
Easy class, horrible prof. Class was complete waste of time because of his lack of effort. Could have been so much better.

Dr. Glassman did a WONDERFUL job with this class! I learned a great deal from him, and only wish I had taken more classes from him. He wanted us to understand processes, not just meaningless facts and data. Although you really have to get into his style, once you do, it's DEFINITELY worth it!!
Do not miss his class, attendance is important.  Seems like he cares but really couldn't say who you are.  Easy grader and grades don't really mean anything to him.  Don't need to read the book!

Hard to understand verbally sometimes.  Funny guy.  When he tells you he'll give extra credit if someone answers something, for goodness sakes do it!  He gave someone an A on a huge paper AND an A on a midterm for answering a question when it was quiet.
