summary_comment: Professor Crowsley is an effective teacher known for her strong opinions, which some students find compelling despite being forceful. Her classes are generally considered easy, which helps mitigate the impact of her polarized viewpoints.
summary_comment_short: Professor Crowsley is an effective teacher known for her strong opinions, which some students find either highly beneficial or intolerable. Her classes are generally considered easy, which helps mitigate the impact of her polarizing viewpoints.

Ratings.comment: Jamie is a good teacher who is very opinionated. If you can't handle a teacher forcing her agenda on you then I suggest to find someone else. However, the class is very easy which makes Jamie's polarized viewpoints bearable.

summary_comment: Professor Fields is highly regarded for her deep knowledge and passion for history, making her classes engaging even early in the morning. She offers multiple opportunities for extra credit and emphasizes attendance and quizzes, making it feasible to achieve high grades. Her approachable nature and ability to connect historical events with contemporary issues make her classes dynamic and thought-provoking.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fields is highly regarded for her extensive knowledge and engaging teaching style, making even early morning classes captivating. She offers numerous opportunities for extra credit and emphasizes active learning through quizzes and discussions, though some find her grading standards challenging.

Ratings.comment: She is one of my favorite profs I've ever had. She had my complete attention at 8am b/c she loves what she teaches and knows a lot about it. She is a history prof so she isn't exactly an easy grader on papers but 40% of your grade is untimed online quizzes and attendance plus multiple extra credit options so it's more than possible to get an A.
In my opinion, she is one of the best professors ever. She didn't force students to study, but students got to study and learn on their will.

Definitely knows her stuff and brings it across in a great manner.  Always willing to visit with students.  Males stubborn in their ways of male dominance might not like her (like student rating on March 7).  Takes the history and is able to apply from then through now really well.  Great class to debate and dialogue freely in as discussions are fu
Very knowledgeable, funny and helpful to anyone interested in sport and society
I thought she was a GREAT professor and super approachable at all times.  Opened my eyes to disparity of women & men in sports then and now.  Highly recommend her class

Terrible class. She is a lawyer so ignorant of teaching. She never taught.Students do all the work, which can be discussed over two meetings.  However she is highly skillful in discriminating students. I guess this is the only thing lawyers know to do. No appreciation to a persons' effort.AVOID.

summary_comment: Professor Childers offers an engaging and interesting class but lacks structured guidance and feedback. While some students found it enjoyable and manageable, others recommend taking the course with Dr. Jones for a more robust learning experience. The class involves minimal difficulty with readings and a few short and two longer papers, but the overall structure is less defined.
summary_comment_short: Professor Childers provides engaging and interesting classes but lacks structured feedback and clear guidance, making the learning experience less effective compared to other instructors. Despite this, some students found her teaching style laid back and enjoyable, noting that active participation and completing readings were key to success.

Ratings.comment: Readings and assignments aren't difficult, but there is little structure to either the classes or the feedback. If you can, just wait to take the class with Dr. Jones; you'll get a lot more out of the experience.

she was an awesome teacher. class was laid back, if you do the readings and participate in the discussion you should be ok. there are a few short papers (1-2 pgs) and 2 long papers (5-8 pgs), but class was always interesting.

summary_comment: Professor Law is known for her challenging yet manageable workload, with clear expectations that turning in assignments on time leads to high grades. Students appreciate her encouragement of direct quotes and her prompt feedback on assignments. While the reading load is substantial, particularly with full-length novels, many find the course rewarding and would take it again.
summary_comment_short: Professor Law offers a manageable course with a focus on participation and timely submission, making it possible to achieve high grades with consistent effort. She provides quick feedback and selects engaging books, particularly for those interested in young adult literature, though the workload, including weekly novel readings and frequent discussions, is substantial.

Ratings.comment: The workload of the class seems intimidating at first, but I'm pretty sure as long as you participate- aka turn everything in- you get a 100% on everything. She also encourages direct quotes, so half of your paper doesn't even need to be your own words. It's easier if you read the books, they're easy, but all in all you can fake it till you make it

It's not hard to get an A as long as you do the assignments and turn them in on time. However the assignments are a lot of work. You have to read a book each week and it's not picture books, they are mostly novels, like one week you have to read a Harry Potter novel. You also have to write a 700 and 500 word discussion post each week.
Instructor Law was nice and gave feedback quickly on assignments. I liked the books that were chosen for the class and learned a lot about young adult literature. I would take again.

summary_comment: Professor Goff is known for his approachable demeanor but has been noted to prioritize students who appear engaged, potentially neglecting those who seem less invested. Conversely, another student describes him as a great, enjoyable professor with a sarcastic sense of humor who makes the class accessible and easy, suggesting high attainability of good grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Goff is known for his approachable demeanor but has been noted to provide less support to students who appear disengaged or confused, potentially affecting their learning experience. On the other hand, some students have praised him for making the class enjoyable with his sarcastic humor and find it relatively easy to achieve high grades.

Ratings.comment: Goff is a really nice professor but he tends to neglect the students he doesn't think are invested in his class. If you tend to be confused and need help staying caught up on what's going on he takes it as a sign of disinterest and doesn't give you as much attention. This makes it really important to stay attentive and caught.
Brent is a great professor and makes this class enjoyable because he is so sarcastic. It is relatively easy and an A is most definitely in your reach! I liked this class! :)

summary_comment: Professor Torres is highly regarded for his dedication to his students, who find him genuinely invested in their learning experience. Despite occasional tangents during lectures, his classes are engaging when students participate actively. His course on early childhood literature delves into significant issues with a balanced approach, integrating political and developmental topics in a respectful manner.
summary_comment_short: Professor Torres is highly regarded for his dedication to his students and his passion for the subject matter, though his lectures can sometimes veer off-topic. He delves into relevant and often politically charged issues in early childhood literature, presenting his views with respect and depth.

Ratings.comment: Francisco is a great professor. He really cares about his students and makes you feel important. Although he can go off on tangents during lecture, if you participate, you'll find the class interesting. Lots of reading involved, but they're all easy books since they are meant for elementary level readers. Great class overall.

This is probably the first review he will get. The early childhood literature class was his first class at Ohio state. I feel as if he goes beyond the material into relevant issues facing the development of the literature. This involves many of the topics that have major political ramifications. He doesn't hide his views, but is very respectful.

summary_comment: Professor Morgan Hoops is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, known for her friendly and approachable demeanor, and her ability to make learning enjoyable and relevant. Students consistently praise her for her supportive nature, excellent feedback, and positive classroom atmosphere, often recommending her class to others.
summary_comment_short: Professor Morgan Hoops is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, known for her engaging and friendly teaching style, which makes the class enjoyable and informative. Students consistently praise her for her helpfulness, relatability, and ability to connect with them, often recommending her class to others.

Ratings.comment: One of the  BEST PROFESSORS at OSU! Enjoyed every minute of her class, learned a lot, very helpful and very friendly. Highly recommended for any class.

Leah is amazing! The course is very standardized but she does everything she can to make it applicable to the students she has in each section. She gives GREAT feedback and is always willing to talk one-on-one with students.

Leah was an amazing teacher. She really cared about her students. The class was really easy, more like a gpa booster than anything else but it was also pretty informative. It had a lot of good study tips in it. If you are taking this class only take it with her, no one else!

This class was really easy, but also fun!  Very laid-back and she doesn't want you to stress about her class at all so she is very lenient.  Recommended for anyone who wants to learn great tips on how to be a better student.
Leah is a great professor. She's so fun and relate able and amazing. She makes this class much funner then I'm sure it really is.

Leah is a wonderful person inside and out. She makes the class enjoyable and helpful, while acknowledging the importance of our other classes. Leah was there whenever I needed someone to talk to. If you have to chance, take this class!

Leah was amazing. Very fun and spirited and always had a positive attitude. It was a joy going to class and it was the class I always looked forward going to. Very relaxed and stress free. Leah and I still talk even though I'm not in class and its great to consider her one of my friends.
Great teacher. Tries lot of innovative ideas in class. Good experience and you get to know about yourself from the exercises.
Great teacher. Cares about her students!

She is the best teacher you'll ever have. Very helpful and makes sure the class is stress free. Truly wants you to succeed. Also, very friendly and down to earth.  Highly recommend the class if looking for some studying skills and a GPA booster. Leah's awesome!!
Best Professor of all time! Take this class! She is the nicest person of all time!

summary_comment: Professor Montanes-Lleras is highly regarded for his engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, which makes the class enjoyable and interactive. Students appreciate his passion for the subject and his encouragement of creative thinking. However, some find the course project-heavy and occasionally too abstract, wishing for more focus on the psychological aspects of children's literature.
summary_comment_short: Professor Montanes-Lleras is highly regarded for his engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, making the class enjoyable and interactive. However, some students find the course could benefit from more focus on the psychological aspects of children's literature and suggest reducing the project load while increasing concrete examples.

Ratings.comment: He's a very good teacher and a very nice man. However, I sometimes found the course a little too "fluffy" and abstract, if you will. I wish we talked more about the psychology behind children's literature. I also think the course was too project-heavy. Also, be prepared to spend $ on books.

This class was so much fun! He really made the projects for each book unique from anything I have done in the past.  The classes are fun and he really helps students to understand what the points are in reading children literature.  Lots of ready obviously but he makes it fun and the class is very enjoyable and not too much of a workload.
This class was so much fun! You do have to apply yourself and do the work, but it was very enjoyable! :)

Andres was very excited about his subject and that was transferred into his students. He encouraged out-of-the-box thinking and was fair about listening to everyone's opinions. His grading is somewhat difficult, but not impossible. It shows that he genuinely cares about what you've written and comments on your assignments.

summary_comment: Professor Beickelman is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and dedication to his students, often described as one of the best teachers in the ELA/Social Studies Ed program. Students praise his willingness to support them and his ability to inspire and engage them in discussions about contemporary teaching challenges. His knowledge and passion for teaching are evident, making his classes both informative and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Beickelman is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and dedication to his students, often described as one of the best educators in the ELA/Social Studies Ed program. Students praise his willingness to support them personally and professionally, and his ability to inspire and engage them in meaningful discussions about teaching.

Ratings.comment: Frank is one of the best teachers I've ever had.  He makes the ELA/Social Studies Ed program what it is, and in ten years, he's probably the only professor I'll remember.  He will fight for you, he'll drop everything he's doing to help you, and he'll inspire you to be a better teacher than you ever thought you could be.

I found it a travesty Frank only has two ratings on here, so I had to add another.  While not the most organized man, Frank is by far one of the most helpful and friendly instructors I have ever had at any level.  He is also one of the advisors for my graduate program, and he is so well connected and respected in Central Ohio education.
Lots of fun and discussion. Frank is great at introducing some of the basic concerns and problems with teaching today, and his class really affirmed my aspirations to become a teacher.
He is so caring and works hard for his students. Plus, he knows a ton about teaching and standards and fun activities. He is interesting and funny. A great class to take!

summary_comment: Professor Lightner is highly regarded by many students for her approachable nature and willingness to help, with several noting her dedication to making classes engaging and supportive. However, some find her teaching methods less effective, particularly regarding the practical application of material and clarity in grading criteria. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some strongly recommending her while others warn against her due to perceived shortcomings in teaching and grading practices.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lightner is highly regarded for her supportive and engaging teaching style, with students praising her willingness to help and clarify concepts. However, some students found her teaching methods less effective for learning the material and criticized her grading policies as overly harsh.

Ratings.comment: She also was my advisor. Very nice and helpful, I gained a valuable resource in meeting her
Sarah is great. She cares about her students and has clear expectations for the classroom.
Good professor who worked hard to make class fun. If you struggle to understand something she is talking about you can ask her for clarification. She is very willing to help her students!

Very sweet teacher, would definitely take her again.  She is very understanding and helpful. You can tell how much effort she puts in to try and make her  class more engaging. Gives wonderful advice for future teachers.

The assignments aren't very helpful in learning the material. She basically just reviews the textbook in class, doesn't really teach and I don't feel like I learned anything from her.  Unclear grading criteria too. Miss more than one class unexcused and your grade drops a third of a letter. Avoid if you want to actually learn how to teach reading.

I just started this class and I don't think the other reviewer is fair. Sarah Lightner seems to be very helpful and she wants you to learn the material for your career. The assignments seem to fit well for the course. I almost did not take this class because of the poor review and I am so glad that I did take a chance and I'm very excited about it.

She is the most unhelpful teacher I have ever had. Her teaching style goes against everything she tells you to do, and she is THE WORST grader. Also, if you miss more than 1 day (that isn't excused from a doctor or a funeral) in THE ENTIRE SEMESTER she drops your grade a LETTER. Shes a middle school teacher teaching elementary phonics. AVOID!

summary_comment: Professor Maynard is highly regarded for her exceptional care and engagement with students. She is known for creating fun and interactive activities that keep students engaged, and she ensures that those who put in the effort achieve great results.
summary_comment_short: Professor Maynard is highly regarded for her exceptional care and engagement with students, making her classes both enjoyable and productive. Her activities are described as fun and effective, provided students fulfill their work requirements.

Ratings.comment: Took Julie for Literacy Media Class, one of the sweetest person I know, she really cares about her students and her activites are fun and engaging, as long as you do the work you will be great.

summary_comment: Professor Davis offers a discussion-based class with no exams, focusing on weekly reviews that are easy and quick to complete. He is described as a good instructor, and students who attend regularly are likely to achieve high grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Davis offers a discussion-based class with no exams, focusing instead on weekly reviews that students find easy and time-efficient. His approach ensures high engagement and, according to students, leads to excellent grades for those who participate regularly.

Ratings.comment: He doesn't believe in exams. Class is basically just a discussion. Show up and talk, you'll do just fine. There is a weekly review due every Monday, but they are easy and take maybe 30-45 minutes. Good guy and you should end up with an A if you show up.

summary_comment: Professor Shenkar is highly regarded for her kindness and willingness to help students, offering numerous opportunities for extra credit and group projects. Her classes are generally considered easy A's, with grades largely dependent on participation and timely submission of assignments. While her lectures can sometimes feel lengthy and meandering, she is praised for her knowledge and down-to-earth demeanor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shenkar is highly regarded for her kindness and willingness to help students, offering numerous opportunities for extra credit and group projects. Her classes are generally considered easy A's with a focus on participation and manageable assignments, though some find her lectures lengthy and occasionally off-topic.

Ratings.comment: I really liked Miriam as a professor. She's a really kind person and will go out of her way to help you if you need it. There were a ton of extra credit opportunities and many group projects. She assigned some reading here and there but it was manageable. I thought that 4280 was an easy A as long as you participate and turned stuff in.

This class is a very easy A. You must participate often in every class to achieve that A though. We had a lot of one-page papers to write. Your grade is mainly participation and the Midterm. She wants to give out A's, so just turn in all assignments and raise your hand a few times each class. The lectures are very long and boring, but it's an easyA

She's very kind and cheerful and knows a lot about education. However, her lectures can drag on a bit and she'll talk about random things. I learned more about the Jewish religion in her class than I ever had before.
Miriam is a wonderful lecturer. She is very down-to-earth, kind and knowledgeable. As long as you do all of the required readings and participate during each class, an A is well within reach.

summary_comment: Professor Green is generally considered approachable and caring, offering multiple opportunities for redemption through extra credit and flexible assignment policies. However, her teaching style can be somewhat lacking in inspiration, with classes often feeling boring due to her tendency to read directly from slides and struggle with leading discussions. Despite this, students appreciate her efforts to engage them and gather feedback, and doing the work diligently can lead to good grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Green is generally considered approachable and caring, offering multiple opportunities for redemption through extra credit and flexible assignment policies. However, her teaching style can be somewhat uninspiring, with classes often feeling slow-paced and lecture-based, which can lead to low participation and a lackluster learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Marissa is not the most inspirational person ever. The material is interesting but her explanation is not the best. She is understandable and willing to help. I did not learn a great a deal from her class and sometimes participation was low which made the class boring.

Very caring and offers a lot of chances to redeem yourself (extra credit, half-credit late assignments) Her lectures are straight from the slides, but attendance is mandatory. She incorporates a lot of discussion breaks and group activities. Exams are worded very awkwardly but you can write a paragraph for each wrong answer and get points back.

Marissa is such a nice person, but  struggles leading a class. Often reads word for word and tries too hard to create activities. However, if you know the vocab and participate the class will be more enjoyable. She is always trying get student feedback. Slow grading, but gives thorough feedback. Offers plenty of correction  (extra credit)
Class is almost unbearably boring, but if you do the work you will get a good grade. Marissa is extremely nice, though, and tries to make sure everyone is involved.

summary_comment: Professor Skaggs is known for his demanding approach, requiring weekly hard copies of 100-point papers and offering minimal feedback until the final. His classes are mandatory, and students often find the grading to be a surprise. While some appreciate his knowledge and dynamic teaching style, others criticize his lack of email responsiveness and the challenging nature of the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Skaggs is known for his demanding approach, requiring weekly hard copies of 100-point papers and minimal feedback until the final exam, making the class grade a surprise. While some students appreciate his knowledge and dynamic teaching style, others find his expectations high and his communication poor.

Ratings.comment: Skaggs is a sub par professor to say the least. He expects a lot out of students and gives little in return. A hard copy of your 100 point paper is due every monday, so you have to go to class. Hopefully you figure out what is going on in this class because you have a greater chance of getting struck by lightening than an e-mail response.

100 point papers are due once a week. you won't see any feedback until after the final so grade in the class is a total surprise. skaggs is your typical gym-rat that somehow has a masters degree, dont worry, he will tell you all about that. class is mandatory to turn in a hard copy of your papers.

I had Skaggs for EDU PAES 312 Alcohol and Drug Issues with Abuse. He was pretty cool most of the class, for the midterm he gave us 40 out of the 50 questions that were on the midterm ahead of time to study. However, if you do not attend the guest lecture you are screwed on the online quiz and the final. So make sure you attend the guest lecture!!!!

I had him for a EDU PAES Class and compared to other classes in the same quarter He was a witch. He did not make the class fun and had an unbelieveable number of in depth questions for a 1 credit hour class over conditioning principles. Do not take.

This guy is a great teacher. He is very knowledgable and cares about his students. The class was very dynamic and he makes it so that you can relate to the material. I would suggest his class, as long as you do your readings and attend. I wish he taught more classes.
Easiest class ever!! But he is kind of bad at returing your e-mails!

summary_comment: Professor Morrow excels in teaching finance and investment, particularly RStudio, though he acknowledges its challenges. He is known for his patience and care in ensuring all students understand the material, despite the time it may take. Students have had consistently positive experiences with his teaching approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Morrow excels in teaching RStudio, a crucial tool for finance and investment, though he acknowledges its challenges. He demonstrates exceptional care and patience, ensuring that all students grasp the material effectively.

Ratings.comment: I am studying Finance and Investment. Rstudio is one of the important programs which we should know about it, it is very challenging and it takes time to put all students on the same page , however, he is very caring and patient. I had the best experience with him.

summary_comment: Professor Jeffery is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, which include practical and hands-on assignments. Students appreciate his understanding demeanor and find his humor particularly helpful, especially during night classes. He is strongly recommended by multiple students who express a willingness to take his classes again.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jeffery is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, which include practical and hands-on assignments. Students appreciate his understanding nature and engaging sense of humor, particularly beneficial for night classes.

Ratings.comment: Really enjoyed his class. The assignments were very practical and hands-on. Very understanding professor. His humor was what helped me get through night classes. Would definitely take again.
Great professor. Love the guy. Highly recommend. Would definitely take his class again

summary_comment: Professor Philip is highly regarded for significantly enhancing students' academic experience, as evidenced by one student's comment that he "totally made my year great." However, his lectures can be lengthy and sometimes confusing due to frequent tangents, and he often keeps students late. Despite these challenges, he is noted for being a fair grader when students put in the necessary effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Philip excels in making his courses engaging but can be lengthy and occasionally confusing due to frequent tangents. Despite this, he is fair in grading and rewarding effort.

Ratings.comment: you totally made my year great ;)
He often gets off topic and is really confusing.  He always keeps students late because he just won't stop talking.  If you show effort though, he is a fair grader.

summary_comment: Professor Carreon is an effective instructor but is known for being challenging, as students find it difficult to achieve high grades and often struggle to understand the material until after the class has concluded. She is generally regarded as decent in her teaching approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Carreon is an effective instructor but known for being challenging, as students find it difficult to achieve good grades and often struggle to understand the material by the end of the class. She is generally considered decent in her teaching approach, though not particularly easy.

Ratings.comment: Good woman, but not esay to get good grade. And i even do not figure out why when the class over.
Overall decent professor.

summary_comment: Professor Rupert is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, described as both intellectually stimulating and engagingly humorous. Students praise his mentorship and his innovative approach to teaching leadership, making his courses both enjoyable and enlightening.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rupert is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, described as both intellectually stimulating and engagingly humorous. Students consistently praise his mentorship and his innovative approach to teaching leadership.

Ratings.comment: Kristen is amazing. She's so smart, helpful, and fun. I would take any class with her! I hope to take another one from her in the near future.
Kristen is amazing. She is an incredible mentor, is hilarious, and helps us understand leadership in innovative ways. I would take any course she offers.

summary_comment: Professor MacBeth is highly regarded for his passionate and insightful lectures, which challenge students to think critically and independently. His teaching style is engaging and often humorous, though some find his lectures can be dense and require active engagement. Students appreciate his encouragement and willingness to provide detailed feedback, making him an excellent mentor.
summary_comment_short: Professor MacBeth is highly regarded for his passionate and insightful lectures grounded in serious research, though some find his classes challenging and less focused on practical assessments. Students appreciate his encouragement, critical thinking exercises, and ability to connect seemingly unrelated topics, making his classes both intellectually stimulating and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: He takes research seriously and shows a great deal of passion. He gives no-nonsense critical and thoughtful lectures. Be prepared to see a new world full of intelligence.

He rambles in lectures and doesn't ask for much input.  His lecture had absolutely nothing to do with the bookpapersquizzes.  Attendance was mandatory and taken every day.  He doesn't give 100% on papers ever but will only take a few points off.  No exams and easy homework.  Easy A.
He is awesome. He is helpful, he is encouraging. I am glad to take class from him even it is not my major:)

Phenomenally interesting guy, with many great stories.  Just when you think he's way off topic, he manages to slyly bring the story back into relevance and tie it to discussion.  If you go into class with open mind and curiousity in life, can gain a lot from it.  Highly recommended!
No Comments
Macbeth has a crazy sense of humor and encourages his students to practice critical thinking and independent analysis.  I thought the class was great.

Brilliant professor and eloquent speaker.  He opens new worlds of understanding to students who are willing to work hard and think hard.  He is also a good mentor and takes time to give students lots of feedback on their work and listen to their ideas. Seriously, he is unbelievably smart!

summary_comment: Professor Grice is a highly engaging instructor who makes difficult subjects accessible and enjoyable. However, her grading can be confusing and becomes stricter as the semester progresses, leading to lower grades for some students. Despite mixed feedback on her time management and clarity of expectations, many find her approachable and supportive, offering extra credit and leniency for missed assignments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Grice is a highly engaging instructor who makes difficult subjects enjoyable and offers substantial support through extra credit opportunities. However, her grading can be inconsistent and confusing, particularly as the semester progresses, leading to frustration among students.

Ratings.comment: Karly has no sense of time! She lets you out of class late and tries to pack way too much stuff into her daily agenda. Its almost the end of the semester and we have yet to receive a grade on ANYTHING. When asked about grades, her response was that she had too much to do over the weekend and didn't get around to doing it. UMM, lady, ITS YOUR JOB!
Great teacher, Funny, easy going, forgiving if you forgot to turn something in. Offers extra credit. As long as you do the work she asks youll get an A. definitely should take her

She grades pretty confusingly and gets harsher towards the end of the semester since her expectations for you rise pretty quickly and on projects. I'm a journalism major and I'm likely gonna get a C in this class even though I've gotten As in similar classes. She also has made it pretty clear she doesn't like me, which is frustrating.
One of my favorite instructors. made a class i had absolutely no interest in enjoyable and easy!
Engaging topics coupled with writing tools. Couldn't ask for more.

summary_comment: Professor Aeh varies widely in student perception; some find her class easy and enjoyable but criticize her for being boring and overly focused on Christianity, lacking structured assignments. Others, however, praise her as an excellent and understanding teacher who makes the course easy and fun, though they note that her availability as a current instructor is uncertain.
summary_comment_short: Professor Aeh varies widely in student perception; some find her classes easy and enjoyable but criticize her for being boring and overly focused on Christianity, while others praise her understanding nature and helpfulness. Overall, opinions are divided, with some considering her the best teacher they've had due to her supportive approach and easy assessments.

Ratings.comment: She's alright. The only good part is that the class is easy. But as a teacher? She's a bit boring, and talks too much about being Christian. Also, there's very little structure to her assignments.

She is an excellent teacher.  She is very interested in the subject and wants her students to do well.  The tests and assignments are very easy.  I don't know if she is teaching this course anymore, though.
THE BEST CLASS I HAVE TAKEN. She is very understanding and helpful.  Easy midterm and final.  TAKE IT!!

LOVED HER!!! This will be one of the best experiences you will have in education. Class meets only one day a week and it is actually fun and interesting. Very understanding and willing to help you in any way.

summary_comment: Professor Barger is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, described as understanding and supportive. Students find her classes engaging and recommend them enthusiastically, particularly for those interested in children's literature.
summary_comment_short: Professor Barger is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, being both understanding and supportive. Her classes are described as interesting and enjoyable, with manageable weekly assignments that can be particularly engaging for those with an interest in literature.

Ratings.comment: Bpb was great! I'd recommend taking any class with her. She is very understanding and willing to help with any circumstances. The weekly assignments are not hard and can be interesting, depending on how interested in literature you are.
Bettie is such a wonderful professor! Her class was really interesting and fun. Definitely recommend taking her for children's lit!

summary_comment: Professor Cilesiz is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and skillful facilitation of discussions. Students find him personable and engaging, which enhances the interest in the qualitative course material through thoughtful exploration of thoughts and feelings.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cilesiz is an excellent instructor known for his effective discussion facilitation and personable demeanor, which makes the qualitative course engaging and interesting through thoughtful exploration of thoughts and feelings.

Ratings.comment: great professor!
Great discussion facilitator.  Personable.
Class discussions made the class interesting.  It being a qualitative course, discussion of thoughts and feelings, made sense.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Creagh is highly regarded for her enthusiasm and passion for the subject, creating engaging and supportive classroom environments. Students appreciate her sense of humor and her ability to make complex topics accessible through real-life examples and discussions. However, some note that she can be inflexible regarding grading and may deduct points strictly for minor infractions like length requirements.
summary_comment_short: Professor Creagh is highly regarded for her enthusiastic and passionate teaching style, which creates a welcoming and engaging learning environment. Her ability to connect with students and bring complex topics to life is evident in the overwhelmingly positive feedback she receives.

Ratings.comment: Christine was an excellent professor. You can tell she is passionate about the subject matter and the students. She always brought a sense of humor to class and used her experiences to help us understand the material. She was wonderful!

I love it when she talks passionately.  I just want to sit in a coffee shop and be passionate with her...especially if she wears a neck scarf. Frankly though, she is the most brilliant woman I've ever met.

Christine is great! She's very friendly and made our class (Multicultural Education, which can be kind of a difficult thing to discuss) easier because she created a comfortable environment. I definitely reccomend her!

Was inflexible about grading. Make sure to take the guidelines of the final research paper seriously. I was a half a page short on length although my content was good and all of my other grades were A's and she took off five points when I was three points away from a much deserved A.
Christine was a very enthusiastic teacher and she graded her assignments generously.  I thought her class was interesting and I liked the way she presented it.  I would recommend her.

Super teacher! Gives every student EVERY chance to get a good grade. If you didn't get an A or B, you probably just didn't try. She brings the material to life, and she's easy on the eyes too! Wish she taught every class at OSU!
So nice and approachable.  Tests for HDFS361 could be tricky at times.  She gives points for attendance (in class activites/discussions).  I didn't buy the book for either class and got A's in both.

Nice teacher, likes to open class up for discussions. Ends up lasting longer than it should, so its sometimes boring to sit in. Only allowed to miss 1 class. Have a paper to write and tests arent too bad. Overall interesting class.

summary_comment: Professor Clark is an effective teacher for survey classes, demonstrating strong pedagogical skills despite the lack of a textbook. She manages to provide comprehensive coverage of the subject matter through engaging lectures and interactive sessions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Clark is an effective teacher for survey classes, adeptly conveying information without the aid of a textbook. Her teaching quality is highly regarded by students.

Ratings.comment: SHE'A A GOOD TEACHER. SINCE THIS IS A SURVEY CLASS, NO TEXTBOOK IS USED

summary_comment: Professor Samimy is known for her approachability and knowledge, but students warn that challenging her in class can lead to severe consequences, making her grading strict. Despite this, she is described as incredibly helpful and flexible, with many praising her professionalism and willingness to support students who seek her assistance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Samimy is highly regarded for her knowledge and approachability, yet students warn that her grading can be stringent if she perceives a challenge or insubordination in class. She is described as very helpful and professional, though her availability is limited, requiring students to make appointments for additional support.

Ratings.comment: Seems very nice, and her classes are interesting. But, to paraphrase Hamlet, I would trust her like "an adder fanged" Get on her wrong side, and "good night," you'll be lucky to pass her course. And any support she might have given you is withdrawn. How to get on her wrong side? Challenge her in class. That'll do it.
Dr. Samimy is one of the most flexible and approachable profs I have had in a long time she is also very knoledgsble

Dr. Samimy is incredibly helpful and knowledgeable about her subject.  I learned alot from her and this course especially.  She's very professional but very busy.  You must make an appointment to see her but its worth it!
Very nice and helpful!

summary_comment: Professor Neef is considered challenging and demanding, with many students finding the course valuable despite its difficulty. However, several students have criticized her teaching methods, citing poor organization, a focus on memorization over practical application, and a lack of relevance to real classroom strategies. Overall, while some find the course rewarding, it is generally viewed negatively due to these issues.
summary_comment_short: Professor Neef's teaching is often described as challenging and demanding, with many students finding the course material difficult and the quizzes particularly tough. However, several students also note that despite the difficulties, the course provides substantial learning opportunities.

Ratings.comment: I agree with the last person who took 742. She was awful. Most of the time she spent class sitting in the corner grading papers or reading magazines. The class was poorly organized and made to be a graduate level for students who were still undergrad. The other section of this class had a better deal.
Hard class, but I learned a lot.

Dr. Neef is a professor who provides a challenging course for her students.  I welcome the challenge!  Beware of the online quizes, they are brutal.  For the person who commented on 742, if you think that the "white" book is useless you do not belong in a special education classroom.

I am a current teacher, took class as part of 2nd graduate degree. Awful professor. Examples irrelevant to education. Right answers only consist of her precise wording- best advice is to memorize definitions from textbook. Textbook dense and not applicable to teaching. She is trying to be useful, but really struggling in classroom strategies.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Legros is highly regarded for her engaging and enjoyable teaching style, which includes interactive games and a supportive atmosphere that makes students feel comfortable. She is praised for her passion and clarity in teaching American Sign Language (ASL), though some note that she can move quickly and may not provide as much additional support to those who struggle. Overall, students strongly recommend her classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Legros is highly regarded for her engaging and fun teaching style, which includes interactive games that enhance learning. Students consistently praise her patience and supportive approach, noting that she makes learners feel comfortable and ensures no one feels embarrassed.

Ratings.comment: Best ASL teacher!!! She is so nice and class is so much fun, we played a lot of games and it made it so much easier to learn! Take her! She does the best at making sure you don't feel stupid if you forget a sign.

Favorite class this quarter, she's a lot of fun, answers any questions, even if they may not be appropriate.  Also she's the hottest ASL teacher I've seen.  Sometimes she's hard to understand because she goes quick but she will answer any questions you have if you get lost.
Emily is amazing, her class is fun and she does a great job making you feel comfortable. Best ASL teacher ive ever had!
Great class, learned a lot. Emily is very nice and funny. My friends had her before and told me to take her class. I really recommend taking her ASL 4 class. Best ASL teacher I've had!
OK

Emily is a great ASL teacher and very passionate about what she does. The material is clear only if you catch on quickly, she's not that helpful to the kids that need extra practice. She does pick favorites as well. Overall ASL is best when you take it with Emily, but you need to keep up on your skills.

emily is the best asl teacher i've had, by far! she expects a lot from her students, but you learn more in this class than other asl classes. she's also very funny and laid back. i highly recommend her
this was my favorite class at osu. if you are taking asl take emily. her class is very fun. not bad on the eyes, either

Emily is a very good teacher. She knows how to teach the language and expects a lot from her kids but nothing that is too crazy. She makes it so that you learn the langugage in a fun way. Would recommend anyone take her class.
Emily is great. Very passionate about teaching and interested in helping her students. If you get a chance, take her class.
Arrogant, interested in teaching only one way despite students needs.
Young, Fun, Helpful, and very interested in teaching ASL to the students.

Very helpful and understanding of the students learning a completely different type of language.  Any questions you had about the class, language, or culture she would answer or at least let you know where to find it out.
Awesome! Willing to help, and fun.

summary_comment: Professor Buckworth is highly regarded for her rigorous approach to teaching, expecting students to be engaged and prepared. She is generally considered helpful and respectful when followed, though some find her lectures monotonous and her demeanor occasionally rude.
summary_comment_short: Professor Buckworth is highly regarded for her rigorous approach to teaching, expecting students to be engaged and prepared. However, some students find her lectures boring and note that she can be rude, particularly when addressing sensitive topics like smoking.

Ratings.comment: She is great! She expects you to come ready to learn, listen, & participate. I have never seen her be rude & she should be addresses as doctor, b/c she earned it! That shows respect.As far as smoking, she pushes being healthy and I think a young person smoking is astonishing to her, after all,we all know it is bad for us.I learned a lot from her!
Excellent professor! Very helpful and really prepared her classes.
No Comments
No Comments

I disagree with the previous ratings.  She was easy, helpful, respected people.  She decided to make our final exam optional for those with a 93% or higher in the class.  The downside was that she was boring.  There were no group projects, a definite plus.  Follow her assignment directions to a tee and you'll be fine.  APA, 1-in margins.

Her lecture's are some of the most boring ever.  She's goes on and on.  She is helpful if you need it, but doesn't go out of her way.  She can be rude at times.  She ripped on a girl that admitted to being a smoker for about a week.
She is extremely rude and only cares about being addressed as  DOCTOR

summary_comment: Professor Dixson demands significant effort from her students to achieve good grades, and her approach can come across as judgmental and unapproachable. Despite this, her class requires substantial hard work to succeed. However, her teaching style does not effectively promote a supportive learning environment, which is ironic given her focus on teaching and learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dixson is known for having high expectations and requiring students to demonstrate significant effort to achieve good grades. However, students perceive her as unapproachable and unhelpful in fostering an encouraging learning environment, despite her focus on teaching and learning.

Ratings.comment: To get a good grade from Dixson you have to show her that you are working hard. There's no way around it.

I did well in her class b/c I worked hard, but as a professor, she does little to encourage the success of her students. She gives the impression that she's judging students and just waiting for them to mess up. Overall, she's unapproachable. Ironically, this professor of "teaching and learning" should pick up some tips on doing just that.

summary_comment: Professor Killinowlueshea is an excellent instructor who makes her classes engaging and enjoyable. She excels in providing support and guidance, particularly for essays and projects, enhancing the overall learning experience. Students highly recommend her classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Killinowlueshea is an excellent instructor who makes her classes engaging and enjoyable. She is highly supportive, particularly in helping students with essays and projects, and is strongly recommended by her students.

Ratings.comment: Wonderful instructor. EDTL 656 was fun yet engaging. She made the class seem like a class and was very helpful when it came to essys and project. I recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Barnhill is an effective instructor who presents the material clearly and encourages independent thinking. He is regarded as a pleasant teacher overall.
summary_comment_short: Professor Barnhill delivers high-quality instruction, presenting material clearly and encouraging independent thinking. He is widely regarded as a pleasant instructor.

Ratings.comment: Sport for the Spectator was actually a pretty interesting class. Barnhill clearly presented the material, encouraged students to think for themselves, and is overall a nice guy.

summary_comment: Professor Tuckman is known for his laid-back teaching style, where students who complete the required work are well-positioned to earn an A in the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tuckman is known for his laid-back teaching style, where students who complete the assigned work tend to perform well and achieve high grades. His approach emphasizes independence and self-motivation in learning.

Ratings.comment: Pretty laid back class. Do the work & you should get an A.

summary_comment: Professor Smith's teaching style is generally perceived as minimalistic, with a focus on easy grading and student-led discussions rather than traditional lecturing. While some students found the class and its content enjoyable and beneficial, particularly appreciating the ease of the assignments and the relevant literature chosen, others criticized her for being unengaging, dismissive, and unresponsive, ultimately deeming her ineffective as a teacher.
summary_comment_short: Professor Smith's teaching style is largely focused on assigning readings and projects rather than active in-class instruction, making the class relatively easy but with limited direct teaching. While some students appreciated the reading material and found the class beneficial, others found her unengaging and unhelpful, with concerns about her responsiveness and demeanor in the classroom.

Ratings.comment: She was okay. Not the friendliest, but nice enough.  The class was super easy.  I really enjoyed the books that she chose.  I actually started and finished one 3 weeks before it was due.  I am glad I took it.  Its true that she doesn't do much in the way of teaching, though.

The 656 had a ton of components to it.  Its definitely overwhelming having her in class. She is demanding. I found minority lit not to be of ANY relevance to the actual course. My experiences with black professors/ gtas is they like to teach it... rightfuly so i guess. For my purposes I would have been MUCH better off taking it from another prof.

I really liked her and the class as a whole. I felt like we had good discussion and the ideas that she got the class to think about were great. Though she doesn't do a whole lot in class and is a very easy grader, I felt like that was very helpful because it forced usto create discussion since it is an education class. I highly recommend her.

Agreed--didn't do much in the way of teaching, presented a few transparencies and some limited in class discussion. The projects and papers were easy, but she seemed to have a habit of calling students out on errors with an attitude just to tell them to see her after class. Did work with me when sick, and accepted paper a week late due to illness.

Easy class, but Worst teacher I ever had. She gave us a syllabus and let the class teach itself. I did not learn a single thing from her.  She would come to class and text on her phone while others were presenting! It takes her at least two weeks to respond to emails.  AVOID THIS TEACHER!

Couldnt agree more with the previous comment. She does not bring much to the table at all as a teacher, she just sits there. Im not saying I dont enjoy a challenge but Im not sure why Ohio State pays her becuase she isnt doing her job.

Easy class if you come to class and do the assigned work.  But as a teacher, she isn't very good at all.  She wasn't friendly, and she talked down to us and got mad easily. The lit was all minority lit, but this wasn't a minority lit class; then she got mad at us for questioning her lit choice. Honestly a painful class.

summary_comment: Professor Thomson excels in creating an engaging and enjoyable learning environment, particularly in her zoo class, where students gain unique insights into animal behavior and habitats without the pressure of tests or difficult assignments. Her classes are highly valued for their entertainment and educational content, making attendance both expected and voluntary.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thomson excels in creating an engaging and enjoyable learning environment, particularly in her zoo class, where students gain unique insights into animal behavior without the pressure of tests or difficult assignments. Her classes are highly valued for their fun and educational content.

Ratings.comment: She is so much fun!  Her zoo class is really easy, but you still learn a lot.  You get an insider's view at the animals and get to see things no other visitors do.  She does expect you to show up to class, but you will want to anyway because it is enjoyable.  Assignments are easy and there are no tests.  Just cool animals observations!

summary_comment: Professor Kurz's teaching quality is mixed. Some students find his class demanding, with extensive reading and expectations of significant out-of-class work, while others appreciate the class discussions and believe active participation leads to high grades. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some students expressing dissatisfaction due to grading delays and perceived mismatched teaching style.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kurz's teaching quality is mixed; some students find his class demanding and feel underprepared due to extensive reading and expected self-study, while others appreciate the interactive discussions and believe active participation leads to high grades.

Ratings.comment: bad. so far i have not recieved a grade in this class, and it is over halfway through. readings are long, and he says that he expects you to spend five hours outside of class working for it. also says he teaches the way his teacher do to him...PHD for undergrad class? we use the same readings that he does. i'm not a huge fan.

I took 306.07. If you go to class and participate and do the work you will get an A. I didnt read like anything he assigned but still got a lot out of the class. dont buy the book rent it from the library. seems overwhelming at first but it actually is pretty easy. good teacher
There is a lot of class discussions.  If you are in class and participate you will get an A.

summary_comment: Professor Trinko is widely regarded as the most outstanding instructor among students, receiving near-unanimous praise for his exceptional teaching quality.
summary_comment_short: Professor Trinko is widely regarded as the most outstanding instructor among all students, receiving unqualified praise for his exceptional teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: No Comments
Most awesomw instructor I have ever had!!

summary_comment: Professor Naumann is highly regarded by some students as an exceptional instructor, describing her as the best teacher they have ever had due to her ease of understanding and supportive nature. Conversely, others find her to be one of the worst teachers they have encountered, criticizing her lack of engagement with students and her inconsistent availability, including taking extended vacations during the academic quarter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Naumann is widely regarded as either an exceptional teacher who makes classes very easy and enjoyable, or one of the worst, noted for her lack of interest in student support and extremely high, often unmet, standards. Students are divided, with some finding her classes invaluable and others considering her one of the most challenging and neglectful instructors they have encountered.

Ratings.comment: The best teacher ever. Very easy. loved her. want to pass? take her class..

She is absolutely the WORST TEACHER I have ever had, and I've had a lot of grad school!  She has no interest in helping students, responding to their e-mails, and will leave school for vacations in the middle of the quarter!!  She also has incredibly high standards for everyone except herself (not returning papers, properly advising students, etc.)

summary_comment: Professor Fishman is known for his easy grading curve, making it possible to achieve an "A" with consistent effort. His classes, particularly when taken online, require significant time commitment but are considered worth it for the low-stakes grading. He is described as engaging and humorous, though some find the material can become repetitive over time.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fishman is known for his easy grading curve, making it possible to achieve high grades with consistent effort. His classes, particularly when taken online, require significant time commitment but are considered manageable and even enjoyable due to his engaging teaching style and prompt responses to emails.

Ratings.comment: An easy A if you do the work.  I took the class online and found him to be very helpful.  Be careful if you take it online, as are several hours of work each work, but its worth it for a 5 point A and no class hours.
Easiest class ever if you do the work.  After a while it gets boring.  The final is a joke, you do not need to study.
Easy class, sweet teacher. He let's you listen to your ipod during class, and makes funny jokes...from time to time.

Easy class, easy instructor! Go to class, turn everything in on time and completed and you are almost guaranteed an A. Keep up on the reading in the 2nd book. I never once sat down and read the text book though. Seth keeps it interesting, and responds to e-mail fast. The only fault, he's a Florida fan, and he lets you know about it.

summary_comment: Professor Meyer is highly regarded for his effective and engaging teaching methods, making his classes enjoyable and easy to follow. He emphasizes current, relevant topics and bases his exams on lectures, often incorporating humor to keep the material interesting. Students consistently praise his clear lectures, minimal busywork, and straightforward test preparation, leading to high satisfaction and positive outcomes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Meyer is highly regarded for his effective and engaging teaching methods, making his classes enjoyable and easy to follow. His lectures are rich in current information and he uses humor to keep the material interesting, leading to excellent test scores based solely on the lecture content.

Ratings.comment: This class was held online at Franklin Univ. He was a wonderful teacher, he didn't bother you too much and allowed you to follow the assignments and get them done.

highly, highly recommended!! he uses humor to keep class fun, is a fair grader (all exams multiple choice and come from lecture), and most importantly he uses *current information*! you learn all up to date information. he introduces hot topics like: education reform, obesity, sex ed, mental illness and keeps things interesting! you'll learn alot!

Kevin is such an easy teacher but you actually learn. Tests are based entirely on the lecture-definitely don't buy the book. This is my third class with Kevin and he never takes things from the book that aren't in the lecture.

by far my favorite teacher at ohio state. he actually made me WANT to go to class every morning! the class is easy.. definitely dont buy the book (the tests are based entirely on lecture). he incorporates funny stories into his lectures to make it interesting and easy to understand

Take this class! He's by far the best professor i've had since starting at OSU. Don't need the book if you go to lecture, and he makes lecture interesting and fun so you wanna be there anyway! He's really funn.. I absolutely loved this class and would take any of classes!

This class was a piece of cake.  He summarizes everything in list form.  Just memorize the lists and you'll do great.  I got 100% on all 3 tests (2 midterms/final).  So easy!   Definitely a GPA booster.  Don't buy the book either.  Pop quizzes are extra credit
Mr. Meyer is an awesome teacher.  He is fun to listen to and his tests are easy.  He doesn't give out assignments that waste your time and his tests are easy as long as you have came to class.

Great Class! high recommend. Don't get the textbook...its really expensive and I never used it. Tests are so easy. The only annoying thing about this class was the stupid comments people made in the class about their families. The class particpation was just annoying after awhile.

has lots of funny stories, makes class interesting, notes are very step by step and easy to follow, not a lot of work involved in the course, tests are easy if you go to class, never even opened the text book and still got an A, all you do is laugh...he's HILARIOUS!:)  TAKE HIS CLASS!!!
He's adorable!  Also, more importantly...he's a great teacher!  Classes are enjoyable.

Great teacher!!! A little scatterbrianed with his notes, but after a few classes you learn to follow. Tests are EASY if you come to class, which you will want to becuase he makes every class fun.  Lots of good stories as well.
The subject matter for this class was mostly interesting, but when it wasn't Kevin made it entertaining. Tons of hilarious stories. I rarely ever missed his class & I am a chronic skipper.

The best I have had at OSU!! Knowledgeable, funny, and HOT ;)! A great guy! Wait to take the class until you can take it with him. His exams are cake, if you review your notes. Great stories, you won't want to sleep in the days you have his class.
I loved his stories! He makes class fun and interesting!
Great teacher and very funny too! It was very interesting to take a class with my cousins fiance teaching it! Makes learning the material enjoyable and can def tell some good stories! :)

great teacher.  If you need this class to fill a GEC requirement take his class for sure.  Makes class interesting and is prety funny.  Also I was one of 2 guys in a class of like 60, so if your looking to meet girls then I would also recomend this class

I loved his class! Made just a boring topic interessting!  He is hilarious! I would seriously not take HDFS 361 until you could make sure he was your GA!  Always knew exactly what would be on the exam, from his lectures!  Best class so far at OSU!
Wonderfully humorous and entertaining.  Just listening about how his fiance got her name (Dawnaka) was priceless.  Similar to Dr. Folden, but humor is more professional/on-topic/unoffensive.
The class is really easy but he never responds to email.....but he does make the class interesting....even by showing a Bill Cosby clip pretty funny
He is very funny and cute.  His stories help us understand and memorize child development more easily. I wish he had good class notes though.
Ok class and kind of funny. Would rate this lower but he beefs it up a little. Seems to care.
He is a great teacher!  His class is always entertaining, he tells great stories and the information you learn is interesting too!
This has been probably the best class I have taken!  His humor made the class more enjoyable then other classes.  TAKE THIS CLASS!!!
Kevin made the class very enjoyable.  His stories mixed with knowledge created a great environment.  I would love to take another class by him!
So funny and entertaining! Best and most fun class I've taken at OSU.  Take this class it's worth it, plus it is so easy (well at least to me it was)
